instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the zdf_ladder opcode for zero-delay feedback ladder filter
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; zdf_ladder opcode: ares zdf_ladder asig, xcf, xQ [, kmode, ksaturation, istor]
    ; Zero-delay feedback ladder filter (24 dB/oct Moog-style)
    ; asig - input signal
    ; xcf - cutoff frequency (Hz)
    ; xQ - resonance (0-10, self-oscillates around 10)
    ; kmode - 0=lowpass I, 1=lowpass II, 2=lowpass III, 3=lowpass IV,
    ;         4=highpass I, 5=highpass II, 6=highpass III, 7=highpass IV,
    ;         8=bandpass I, 9=bandpass II (default 0)
    ; ksaturation - saturation amount (0-3, default 1)
    ; istor - skip initialization
    
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Sawtooth wave
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 110, 0
    
    ; Classic sweep with resonance
    kCutoff expseg 150, p3*0.3, 3500, p3*0.4, 800, p3*0.3, 200
    kRes = 7
    kMode = 0  ; Lowpass I (4-pole)
    
    aFilt zdf_ladder aSaw, kCutoff, kRes, kMode, 1.0
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Self-oscillating zdf_ladder
    kAmp madsr 0.015, 0.08, 0.5, 0.25
    
    ; Minimal excitation
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.03, 0
    
    ; High resonance
    kCutoff linseg 300, p3*0.5, 2000, p3*0.5, 500
    kRes = 9.5
    kMode = 0
    
    aFilt zdf_ladder aNoise, kCutoff, kRes, kMode, 1.0
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Bandpass mode
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.12, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Pulse wave
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.35, 165, 2, 0.4
    
    ; Bandpass filter
    kCenter expseg 400, p3*0.4, 2500, p3*0.6, 700
    kQ = 6
    kMode = 8  ; Bandpass I
    
    aFilt zdf_ladder aPulse, kCenter, kQ, kMode, 1.2
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 4
    ; High saturation zdf_ladder
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.65, 0.2
    
    ; Square wave
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 2
    
    ; Moderate sweep with high saturation
    kCutoff expseg 300, p3*0.5, 1800, p3*0.5, 500
    kRes = 6.5
    kMode = 0
    
    ; High saturation for warmth
    aFilt zdf_ladder aSq, kCutoff, kRes, kMode, 2.5
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

i1 0 4
i2 4.5 4
i3 9 4
i4 13.5 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the mvchpf family of opcodes for highpass filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; mvchpf opcode: ares mvchpf asig, xcf [, istor]
    ; 4-pole highpass filter (24 dB/oct)
    ; asig - input signal
    ; xcf - cutoff frequency (Hz)
    ; istor - skip initialization
    
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Pulse wave with rich harmonics
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.35, 110, 2, 0.3
    
    ; Sweep highpass cutoff
    kCutoff expseg 2000, p3*0.4, 200, p3*0.6, 1500
    
    aFilt mvchpf aPulse, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; mvchpf1 opcode: ares mvchpf1 asig, xcf [, istor]
    ; 1-pole highpass filter (6 dB/oct)
    
    kAmp madsr 0.015, 0.08, 0.65, 0.25
    
    ; Sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 165, 0
    
    ; Gentle highpass
    kCutoff expseg 1500, p3*0.5, 300, p3*0.5, 1000
    
    aFilt mvchpf1 aSaw, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; mvchpf2 opcode: ares mvchpf2 asig, xcf [, istor]
    ; 2-pole highpass filter (12 dB/oct)
    
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.12, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Square wave
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 2
    
    ; Medium highpass
    kCutoff expseg 1800, p3*0.3, 400, p3*0.4, 1200, p3*0.3, 800
    
    aFilt mvchpf2 aSq, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 4
    ; mvchpf3 opcode: ares mvchpf3 asig, xcf [, istor]
    ; 3-pole highpass filter (18 dB/oct)
    
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.55, 0.2
    
    ; Pulse wave
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.35, 165, 2, 0.5
    
    ; Steep highpass
    kCutoff expseg 2500, p3*0.5, 350, p3*0.5, 1800
    
    aFilt mvchpf3 aPulse, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 5
    ; mvchpf4 opcode: ares mvchpf4 asig, xcf [, istor]
    ; Same as mvchpf (4-pole, 24 dB/oct)
    
    kAmp madsr 0.015, 0.08, 0.65, 0.25
    
    ; Sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 110, 0
    
    ; Very steep highpass
    kCutoff expseg 3000, p3*0.4, 250, p3*0.6, 2000
    
    aFilt mvchpf4 aSaw, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 6
    ; Compare different slopes
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.2
    
    ; Rich source
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 2, 0.4
    
    ; Same cutoff for all
    kCutoff expseg 1500, p3*0.5, 400, p3*0.5, 1200
    
    ; Different slopes
    aFilt1 mvchpf1 aPulse, kCutoff  ; 6 dB/oct
    aFilt2 mvchpf3 aPulse, kCutoff  ; 18 dB/oct
    
    outs aFilt1, aFilt2
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

i1 0 3
i2 3.5 3
i3 7 3
i4 10.5 3
i5 14 3
i6 17.5 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the chorus opcode for chorus effect
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; chorus opcode: a1, a2 chorus asig, kpreset, kgain, \ 
    ;                idepth, idelay [, iseed] [, iprelay]
    ; Stereo chorus effect
    ; asig - input signal
    ; kpreset - chorus preset (1-9)
    ; kgain - output gain
    ; idepth - modulation depth (0-1)
    ; idelay - base delay time (ms, typically 5-30)
    ; iseed - random seed (optional)
    ; iprelay - predelay (optional)
    
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 0
    
    ; Apply chorus
    kPreset = 1
    kGain = 1
    iDepth = 0.8
    iDelay = 15
    
    aChorusL, aChorusR chorus aSaw, kPreset, kGain, iDepth, iDelay
    
    outs aChorusL, aChorusR
endin

instr 2
    ; Subtle chorus
    kAmp madsr 0.015, 0.08, 0.65, 0.25
    
    ; Pulse wave
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.3, 165, 2, 0.4
    
    ; Subtle settings
    kPreset = 2
    kGain = 0.9
    iDepth = 0.4
    iDelay = 10
    
    aL, aR chorus aPulse, kPreset, kGain, iDepth, iDelay
    
    outs aL, aR
endin

instr 3
    ; Deep chorus
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.12, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Square wave
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.3, 110, 2
    
    ; Deep chorus
    kPreset = 5
    kGain = 1.1
    iDepth = 0.95
    iDelay = 25
    
    aL, aR chorus aSq, kPreset, kGain, iDepth, iDelay
    
    outs aL, aR
endin

instr 4
    ; Changing preset
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Sawtooth
    aSaw1 vco2 kAmp*0.15, 110, 0
    aSaw2 vco2 kAmp*0.15, 110.5, 0
    aSrc = aSaw1 + aSaw2
    
    ; Sweep presets
    kPreset linseg 1, p3*0.33, 3, p3*0.33, 6, p3*0.34, 8
    kGain = 1
    iDepth = 0.7
    iDelay = 18
    
    aL, aR chorus aSrc, kPreset, kGain, iDepth, iDelay
    
    outs aL, aR
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

i1 0 4
i2 4.5 4
i3 9 4
i4 13.5 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates noise reduction and gating opcodes: median, mediank, compress2 as gate
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; median opcode: ares median asig, ksize [, imaxsize]
    ; Median filter for impulse noise removal
    ; ksize - window size (must be odd)
    
    ; Clean signal
    aClean oscili 0.3, 440, -1
    
    ; Add impulse noise
    kTrig metro 10
    aNoise rand 0.5
    aNoise *= kTrig
    
    aNoisy = aClean + aNoise
    
    ; Remove impulses with median filter
    aFiltered median aNoisy, 5
    
    outs aNoisy*0.5, aFiltered*0.5
endin

instr 2
    ; mediank opcode: kres mediank ksig, ksize [, imaxsize]
    ; Median filter for k-rate signals
    
    ; Generate noisy control signal
    kClean linseg 220, p3, 880
    kNoise random -50, 50
    kNoisy = kClean + kNoise
    
    ; Smooth with median filter
    kSmooth mediank kNoisy, 7
    
    ; Use for frequency control
    aOscNoisy oscili 0.3, kNoisy, -1
    aOscSmooth oscili 0.3, kSmooth, -1
    
    outs aOscNoisy*0.5, aOscSmooth*0.5
endin

instr 3
    ; Noise gate using compress2
    ; compress2 opcode: ar1 compress2 asig, actl, kthresh, kloknee, khiknee, kratio, katt, krel, ilook
    ; With ratio < 1, acts as expander/gate
    
    ; Signal with varying amplitude
    aIn vco2 0.4, 220, 0
    aIn *= linseg(0.05, 0.5, 0.8, 1, 0.1, 0.5, 0.6, p3-2, 0.05)
    
    ; Add noise floor
    aNoise rand 0.03
    aIn = aIn + aNoise
    
    ; Gate parameters
    kThresh = -30  ; Threshold in dB
    kLoKnee = 3
    kHiKnee = 3
    kRatio = 0.1   ; Expansion ratio (< 1 for gate)
    kAtt = 0.003
    kRel = 0.05
    iLook = 0.005
    
    ; Apply gate
    aGated compress2 aIn, aIn, kThresh, kLoKnee, kHiKnee, kRatio, kAtt, kRel, iLook
    
    outs aIn*0.5, aGated*0.5
endin

instr 4
    ; Adaptive noise reduction
    ; Estimate and subtract noise floor
    
    ; Main signal
    aMain buzz 0.4, 330, 15, -1
    aMain *= linseg(1, 0.3, 0.2, 0.5, 1, p3-0.8, 0.5)
    
    ; Add noise
    aNoise rand 0.1
    aNoisy = aMain + aNoise
    
    ; Measure noise level during quiet passages
    kRMS rms aNoisy
    kNoiseFloor = (kRMS < 0.15 ? kRMS : kNoiseFloor)
    
    ; Gate based on noise floor
    kThresh = ampdb(dbamp(kNoiseFloor) + 6)
    kGate = (kRMS > kThresh ? 1 : 0)
    kGateSmooth port kGate, 0.01
    
    aOut = aNoisy * kGateSmooth
    
    outs aNoisy*0.5, aOut*0.5
endin

instr 5
    ; Spectral noise reduction using PVS
    ; Reduce noise in frequency domain
    
    ; Signal with noise
    aSignal vco2 0.3, 220, 10
    aNoise rand 0.08
    aIn = aSignal + aNoise
    
    ; Analyze
    fsig pvsanal aIn, 1024, 256, 1024, 1
    
    ; Create noise profile (in practice would be learned)
    ; Simulate with spectral gate
    fgated pvsgain fsig, 0.8
    
    ; Synthesize
    aOut pvsynth fgated
    
    outs aIn*0.5, aOut*0.5
endin

instr 6
    ; Multi-band gating
    ; Different gates for different frequency bands
    
    aIn vco2 0.4, 165, 0
    aIn *= linseg(0.8, 0.3, 0.1, 0.4, 0.7, 0.5, 0.2, p3-1.2, 0.1)
    
    ; Add noise
    aNoise rand 0.05
    aIn = aIn + aNoise
    
    ; Split into bands
    aLow butterlp aIn, 500
    aMid butterbp aIn, 1500, 1000
    aHigh butterhp aIn, 3000
    
    ; Gate each band
    kThreshLow = -35
    kThreshMid = -30
    kThreshHigh = -25
    
    aLowGated compress2 aLow, aLow, kThreshLow, 3, 3, 0.1, 0.005, 0.05, 0.005
    aMidGated compress2 aMid, aMid, kThreshMid, 3, 3, 0.1, 0.005, 0.05, 0.005
    aHighGated compress2 aHigh, aHigh, kThreshHigh, 3, 3, 0.1, 0.005, 0.05, 0.005
    
    ; Recombine
    aOut = aLowGated + aMidGated + aHighGated
    
    outs aIn*0.5, aOut*0.5
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

i1 0 3
i2 4 4
i3 9 4
i4 14 3
i5 18 3
i6 22 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates algorithmic reverb opcodes: reverb, reverb2
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; reverb opcode: ares reverb asig, krvt [, iskip]
    ; Simple reverb with reverb time parameter
    ; asig - input signal
    ; krvt - reverb time (seconds)
    ; iskip - skip initialization
    
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Short pluck
    aPluck pluck kAmp*0.4, 440, 440, 0, 1
    
    ; Add reverb
    kRvtTime = 2.5
    aReverb reverb aPluck, kRvtTime
    
    ; Mix dry and wet
    aMix = aPluck*0.3 + aReverb*0.7
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

instr 2
    ; Variable reverb time
    kAmp madsr 0.015, 0.08, 0.65, 0.25
    
    ; Pulse wave
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.3, 330, 2, 0.4
    aEnv expon 1, 0.2, 0.01
    aSound = aPulse * aEnv
    
    ; Sweep reverb time
    kRvtTime linseg 0.5, p3, 4.0
    aReverb reverb aSound, kRvtTime
    
    outs aReverb, aReverb
endin

instr 3
    ; reverb2 opcode: aoutL, aoutR reverb2 asigL, asigR, ktime, khdif [, iskip]
    ; Stereo reverb with high-frequency diffusion
    ; asigL, asigR - stereo input
    ; ktime - reverb time (seconds)
    ; khdif - high-frequency diffusion (0-1, default 0.5)
    ; iskip - skip initialization
    
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.12, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 0
    aEnv expon 1, 0.15, 0.01
    aSound = aSaw * aEnv
    
    ; Stereo reverb
    kTime = 3.0
    kHdif = 0.6
    aRevL, aRevR reverb2 aSound, aSound, kTime, kHdif
    
    ; Mix
    aL = aSound*0.2 + aRevL*0.8
    aR = aSound*0.2 + aRevR*0.8
    
    outs aL, aR
endin

instr 4
    ; Dynamic reverb parameters
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Impulse train
    aImp mpulse kAmp*0.5, 1.5
    
    ; Varying parameters
    kTime linseg 1.0, p3*0.5, 4.0, p3*0.5, 1.5
    kHdif linseg 0.3, p3, 0.9
    
    aRevL, aRevR reverb2 aImp, aImp, kTime, kHdif
    
    outs aRevL, aRevR
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

i1 0 4
i2 4.5 4
i3 9 4
i4 13.5 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates convolution reverb opcodes: convolve, dconv, ftconv
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Simple impulse response table
giIR ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0.8, 0.6, 0.4, 0.3, 0.2, 0.15, 0.1

instr 1
    ; convolve opcode: ares convolve asig, ifilcod [, ichannel]
    ; Convolve audio signal with impulse response file
    ; asig - input signal
    ; ifilcod - impulse response file (WAV/AIFF)
    ; ichannel - channel to use from IR file
    ; Note: Requires external IR file
    
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Impulse train for testing
    aImp mpulse kAmp*0.5, 1.5
    
    ; Convolve (would use external IR file)
    ; aConv convolve aImp, "impulse_response.wav"
    
    ; Simulated with simple delay network
    aBuf delayr 0.5
    aD1 deltap 0.05
    aD2 deltap 0.12
    aD3 deltap 0.23
    aD4 deltap 0.38
    delayw aImp
    
    aConv = aImp + aD1*0.6 + aD2*0.4 + aD3*0.3 + aD4*0.2
    
    outs aConv, aConv
endin

instr 2
    ; ftconv opcode: ares ftconv asig, ift, iplen [, iskip [, ilen [, iparts]]]
    ; Fast table-based convolution
    ; asig - input signal
    ; ift - function table with impulse response
    ; iplen - partition length (power of 2)
    ; iskip - skip initialization
    ; ilenExcerpt - length of IR to use
    ; iparts - number of partitions
    
    kAmp madsr 0.015, 0.08, 0.65, 0.25
    
    ; Pluck sound
    aPluck pluck kAmp*0.4, 330, 330, 0, 1
    
    ; Convolve with table
    iPlen = 256
    aConv ftconv aPluck, giIR, iPlen
    
    outs aConv, aConv
endin

instr 3
    ; dconv opcode: ares dconv asig, isize, ifn
    ; Direct convolution
    ; asig - input signal
    ; isize - size of impulse response
    ; ifn - function table with IR
    
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.12, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Pulse wave
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 2, 0.4
    aEnv expon 1, 0.15, 0.01
    aSound = aPulse * aEnv
    
    ; Direct convolution
    iSize = ftlen(giIR)
    aConv dconv aSound, iSize, giIR
    
    outs aConv, aConv
endin

instr 4
    ; Complex IR with ftconv
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 165, 0
    aEnv expon 1, 0.18, 0.01
    aSound = aSaw * aEnv
    
    ; Partitioned convolution for efficiency
    iPlen = 512
    aConv ftconv aSound, giIR, iPlen
    
    ; Mix
    aMix = aSound*0.2 + aConv*0.8
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

i1 0 3
i2 3.5 3
i3 7 3
i4 10.5 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the platerev opcode for plate reverb simulation
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; platerev opcode: aoutL, aoutR platerev ainL, ainR, kbandwidth, ktail, kblend [, isamplerate] [, iskip]
    ; Plate reverb simulation
    ; ainL, ainR - stereo input
    ; kbandwidth - bandwidth (0-1, affects density)
    ; ktail - tail length (0-1, affects decay time)
    ; kblend - wet/dry mix (0-1, 0=dry, 1=wet)
    ; isamplerate - sample rate (optional)
    ; iskip - skip initialization
    
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Pluck sound
    aPluck pluck kAmp*0.4, 440, 440, 0, 1
    
    ; Plate reverb
    kBW = 0.7
    kTail = 0.75
    kBlend = 0.8
    
    aRevL, aRevR platerev aPluck, aPluck, kBW, kTail, kBlend
    
    outs aRevL, aRevR
endin

instr 2
    ; Bright plate
    kAmp madsr 0.015, 0.08, 0.65, 0.25
    
    ; Pulse wave
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.3, 330, 2, 0.4
    aEnv expon 1, 0.2, 0.01
    aSound = aPulse * aEnv
    
    ; Bright, short plate
    kBW = 0.9
    kTail = 0.4
    kBlend = 0.9
    
    aRevL, aRevR platerev aSound, aSound, kBW, kTail, kBlend
    
    outs aRevL, aRevR
endin

instr 3
    ; Dark, long plate
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.12, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 0
    aEnv expon 1, 0.15, 0.01
    aSound = aSaw * aEnv
    
    ; Dark, long plate
    kBW = 0.3
    kTail = 0.95
    kBlend = 0.85
    
    aRevL, aRevR platerev aSound, aSound, kBW, kTail, kBlend
    
    outs aRevL, aRevR
endin

instr 4
    ; Dynamic plate parameters
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.2
    
    ; Impulse train
    aImp mpulse kAmp*0.5, 2
    
    ; Sweep parameters
    kBW linseg 0.3, p3*0.5, 0.95, p3*0.5, 0.5
    kTail linseg 0.4, p3, 0.9
    kBlend = 0.8
    
    aRevL, aRevR platerev aImp, aImp, kBW, kTail, kBlend
    
    outs aRevL, aRevR
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

i1 0 4
i2 4.5 3
i3 8 4
i4 12.5 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates stereo enhancement opcodes: freeverb, reverbsc for width, stereomix, mirror
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; freeverb opcode: aoutL, aoutR freeverb ainL, ainR, kRoomSize, kHFDamp [, iSRate, iSkip]
    ; Stereo reverb for width enhancement
    ; kRoomSize - room size (0-1)
    ; kHFDamp - high-frequency damping (0-1)
    
    ; Mono source
    aIn oscili 0.3, 440, -1
    
    ; Freeverb for stereo width
    kRoomSize = 0.7
    kHFDamp = 0.5
    
    aRevL, aRevR freeverb aIn, aIn, kRoomSize, kHFDamp
    
    ; Mix dry and wet
    aOutL = aIn*0.6 + aRevL*0.4
    aOutR = aIn*0.6 + aRevR*0.4
    
    outs aOutL, aOutR
endin

instr 2
    ; reverbsc opcode: aoutL, aoutR reverbsc ainL, ainR, kfblvl, kfco [, israte, ipitchm, iskip]
    ; Sean Costello reverb for stereo enhancement
    ; kfblvl - feedback level (0-1)
    ; kfco - cutoff frequency
    
    aIn vco2 0.3, 330, 10
    
    ; Reverbsc for width
    kFeedback linseg 0.7, p3*0.5, 0.9, p3*0.5, 0.75
    kCutoff = 8000
    
    aRevL, aRevR reverbsc aIn, aIn, kFeedback, kCutoff
    
    aOutL = aIn*0.5 + aRevL*0.5
    aOutR = aIn*0.5 + aRevR*0.5
    
    outs aOutL, aOutR
endin

instr 3
    ; Stereo width control
    ; M-S processing for enhancement
    
    ; Stereo source
    aL oscili 0.3, 440, -1
    aR vco2 0.3, 550, 10
    
    ; Convert to mid-side
    aMid = (aL + aR) * 0.5
    aSide = (aL - aR) * 0.5
    
    ; Enhance width by boosting side
    kWidth linseg 1, p3*0.5, 3, p3*0.5, 1
    aSideEnh = aSide * kWidth
    
    ; Convert back to L-R
    aOutL = aMid + aSideEnh
    aOutR = aMid - aSideEnh
    
    outs aOutL, aOutR
endin

instr 4
    ; mirror opcode simulation
    ; Reflect left/right channels
    
    aL oscili 0.3, 330, -1
    aR vco2 0.3, 440, 10
    
    ; Crossfade to mirrored version
    kMirror linseg 0, p3*0.5, 1, p3*0.5, 0
    
    aOutL = aL*(1-kMirror) + aR*kMirror
    aOutR = aR*(1-kMirror) + aL*kMirror
    
    outs aOutL, aOutR
endin

instr 5
    ; Haas effect for width
    ; Short delay for stereo enhancement
    
    aIn buzz 0.3, 220, 20, -1
    
    ; Delays
    aDelL delayr 0.05
    aTapL deltapi 0.015
          delayw aIn
    
    aDelR delayr 0.05
    aTapR deltapi 0.021
          delayw aIn
    
    ; Mix
    aOutL = aIn*0.6 + aTapL*0.4
    aOutR = aIn*0.6 + aTapR*0.4
    
    outs aOutL, aOutR
endin

instr 6
    ; Combined stereo enhancement
    ; Reverb + width + Haas effect
    
    aIn vco2 0.3, 165, 0
    
    ; Reverb for ambience
    kRoom = 0.6
    kDamp = 0.6
    aRevL, aRevR freeverb aIn, aIn, kRoom, kDamp
    
    ; Haas delay
    aDelL delayr 0.03
    aTapL deltapi 0.012
          delayw aIn + aRevL*0.3
    
    aDelR delayr 0.03
    aTapR deltapi 0.018
          delayw aIn + aRevR*0.3
    
    ; M-S width enhancement
    aMid = (aTapL + aTapR) * 0.5
    aSide = (aTapL - aTapR) * 0.5
    aSideEnh = aSide * 1.5
    
    aOutL = aMid + aSideEnh
    aOutR = aMid - aSideEnh
    
    outs aOutL*0.8, aOutR*0.8
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

i1 0 4
i2 5 4
i3 10 4
i4 15 3
i5 19 3
i6 23 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the hsboscil opcode for harmonic oscillator with amplitude and frequency modulation
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Wave table
giWave ftgen 1, 0, 16384, 10, 1
; Harmonic amplitude envelope over time
giHarmEnv ftgen 2, 0, 1024, 7, 0, 128, 1, 512, 0.5, 384, 0
; Frequency deviation pattern
giFreqDev ftgen 3, 0, 1024, 10, 1, 0.5, 0.3

instr 1
    ; hsboscil opcode: ares hsboscil kamp, ktone, kbrite, ibasfreq, iwfn, ioctfn [, ioctcnt] [, iphs]
    ; hsboscil is a harmonic oscillator with brightness control
    ; kamp - amplitude
    ; ktone - frequency multiplier relative to base frequency
    ; kbrite - brightness (number of harmonics, approximately)
    ; ibasfreq - base frequency in Hz
    ; iwfn - waveform table
    ; ioctfn - octave band filter table
    ; ioctcnt - number of octave bands (optional)
    ; iphs - initial phase (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Tone (pitch multiplier)
    kTone = 1
    
    ; Brightness changes over time
    kBrite linseg 1, p3*0.5, 10, p3*0.5, 3
    
    ; Base frequency
    iBaseFreq = 220
    
    ; Generate tone with varying harmonic content
    aSigL hsboscil kAmp, kTone, kBrite, iBaseFreq, giWave, giHarmEnv
    aSigR hsboscil kAmp, kTone*1.002, kBrite, iBaseFreq, giWave, giHarmEnv
    
    outs aSigL, aSigR
endin

instr 2
    ; Demonstrate frequency modulation with hsboscil
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.1, 0.6, 0.4
    
    ; Tone modulation (pitch vibrato)
    kToneMod oscili 0.02, 5, giWave
    kTone = 1 + kToneMod
    
    ; Fixed brightness
    kBrite = 8
    
    ; Higher base frequency
    iBaseFreq = 440
    
    aSigL hsboscil kAmp*0.3, kTone, kBrite, iBaseFreq, giWave, giHarmEnv
    aSigR hsboscil kAmp*0.3, kTone, kBrite, iBaseFreq*1.005, giWave, giHarmEnv
    
    outs aSigL, aSigR
endin

instr 3
    ; Spectral morphing demonstration
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.35, p3-0.2, 0.35, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Sweep through different tonal centers
    kTone linseg 0.5, p3, 2
    
    ; Brightness sweep
    kBrite linseg 2, p3*0.3, 15, p3*0.4, 8, p3*0.3, 3
    
    iBaseFreq = 165
    
    aSigL hsboscil kAmp, kTone, kBrite, iBaseFreq, giWave, giHarmEnv
    aSigR hsboscil kAmp, kTone*0.998, kBrite, iBaseFreq, giWave, giHarmEnv
    
    outs aSigL, aSigR
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play instrument 1 (brightness sweep)
i1 0 4
; Play instrument 2 (vibrato)
i2 4.5 3
; Play instrument 3 (spectral morphing)
i3 8 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates low-frequency oscillators
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

giSine ftgen 1, 0, 16384, 10, 1
giSaw ftgen 2, 0, 16384, 10, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.25, 0.2

instr 1
    ; lfo opcode: kres lfo kamp, kcps [, itype]
    ; lfo generates low frequency oscillation
    ; kamp - amplitude
    ; kcps - frequency in Hz
    ; itype - waveform type (0=sine, 1=triangle, 2=square up, 3=square down, 4=saw up, 5=saw down)
    
    iAmp = 0.5
    iFreq = 440
    
    ; Sine LFO for amplitude modulation
    kLFO lfo 0.3, 5, 0
    kAmp = 0.2 + kLFO
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, iFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 2
    ; Triangle LFO
    iAmp = 0.5
    iFreq = 440
    
    kLFO lfo 0.3, 4, 1
    kAmp = 0.2 + kLFO
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, iFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 3
    ; Square wave LFO for tremolo
    iAmp = 0.5
    iFreq = 440
    
    kLFO lfo 0.25, 6, 2
    kAmp = 0.25 + kLFO
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, iFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 4
    ; lfsr opcode: ares lfsr kreg, imask, ishift
    ; lfsr generates pseudo-random sequences using linear feedback shift register
    ; kreg - register value
    ; imask - bit mask
    ; ishift - shift amount
    
    ; Note: lfsr is typically used for modulation
    ; Demonstration with basic noise-like modulation
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = 440
    
    ; Random modulation
    kRand randh 50, 10
    kFreq = iFreq + kRand
    
    aOsc poscil iAmp, kFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

instr 5
    ; LFO on filter cutoff
    iAmp = 0.5
    iFreq = 220
    
    aSource poscil iAmp, iFreq, giSaw
    
    ; LFO controls filter
    kLFO lfo 2000, 0.5, 0
    kCutoff = 800 + kLFO
    
    aFilt butterlp aSource, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 6
    ; Multiple LFOs
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = 330
    
    ; LFO 1: amplitude
    kLFO1 lfo 0.2, 4, 0
    kAmp = 0.3 + kLFO1
    
    ; LFO 2: frequency (vibrato)
    kLFO2 lfo 10, 5.5, 0
    kFreq = iFreq + kLFO2
    
    aOsc poscil kAmp, kFreq, giSine
    
    outs aOsc, aOsc
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play sine LFO
i1 0 3

; Play triangle LFO
i2 4 3

; Play square LFO
i3 8 3

; Play random modulation
i4 12 3

; Play filter LFO
i5 16 4

; Play multiple LFOs
i6 21 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the oscili opcode by generating a frequency-modulated tone with cubic interpolation

kr = 4410
ksmps = 10

; Function table 1: sine wave

instr 1
    ; oscili opcode: asig oscili xamp, xcps, ifn [, iphs]
    ; oscili uses cubic interpolation for higher quality

    ; xcps - frequency in Hz (can be k-rate or a-rate)
    ; ifn - function table number

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates resonant filter models
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

giSaw ftgen 1, 0, 16384, 10, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.25, 0.2, 0.16

instr 1
    ; mode opcode: aout mode ain, kfreq, kq [, iskip]
    ; mode implements resonant mode filter
    ; ain - input signal
    ; kfreq - resonant frequency
    ; kq - quality factor (higher = narrower)
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Impulse excitation
    aExcite mpulse 0.8, 0
    
    ; Resonant mode
    kResFreq = iFreq
    kQ = 500
    
    aMode mode aExcite, kResFreq, kQ
    
    outs aMode*iAmp, aMode*iAmp
endin

instr 2
    ; streson opcode: asig streson ain, kfr, kfdbgain
    ; streson is string resonator
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    aExcite mpulse 0.8, 0
    
    kFeedback = 0.95
    
    aString streson aExcite, iFreq, kFeedback
    
    outs aString*iAmp, aString*iAmp
endin

instr 3
    ; resony opcode: ares resony asig, kcf, kbw [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; resony implements resonant bandpass filter
    ; kcf - center frequency
    ; kbw - bandwidth
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Source signal
    aSource poscil 0.5, iFreq, giSaw
    
    ; Resonant filter
    kCF = iFreq * 2
    kBW = 50
    
    aReson resony aSource, kCF, kBW
    
    outs aReson*iAmp, aReson*iAmp
endin

instr 4
    ; resonr opcode: ares resonr asig, kcf, kbw [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; resonr is resonator (bandpass + notch)
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    aSource poscil 0.5, iFreq, giSaw
    
    kCF = iFreq * 1.5
    kBW = 100
    
    aReson resonr aSource, kCF, kBW
    
    outs aReson*iAmp, aReson*iAmp
endin

instr 5
    ; resonz opcode: ares resonz asig, kcf, kbw [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; resonz implements zero-delay feedback resonator
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    aSource poscil 0.5, iFreq, giSaw
    
    kCF = iFreq * 2.5
    kBW = 80
    
    aReson resonz aSource, kCF, kBW
    
    outs aReson*iAmp, aReson*iAmp
endin

instr 6
    ; vlowrez opcode: ares vlowrez asig, xfco, xres, iattn, iord [, iskip]
    ; vlowrez implements resonant low-pass filter
    ; xfco - cutoff frequency
    ; xres - resonance (0-1)
    ; iattn - attenuation
    ; iord - filter order (1-4)
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    aSource poscil 0.5, iFreq, giSaw
    
    ; Sweeping resonant filter
    kCutoff expseg 200, p3, 3000
    kRes = 0.8
    iAttn = 0.5
    iOrder = 4
    
    aFilt vlowrez aSource, kCutoff, kRes, iAttn, iOrder
    
    outs aFilt*iAmp, aFilt*iAmp
endin

instr 7
    ; Multiple resonant modes (bell-like)
    iAmp = 0.3
    iFreq = p4
    
    aExcite mpulse 0.8, 0
    
    ; Several inharmonic modes
    aMode1 mode aExcite, iFreq, 500
    aMode2 mode aExcite, iFreq*2.76, 400
    aMode3 mode aExcite, iFreq*5.40, 300
    aMode4 mode aExcite, iFreq*8.93, 200
    
    aMix = (aMode1 + aMode2*0.7 + aMode3*0.5 + aMode4*0.3) * iAmp
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play mode filter
i1 0 3 440
i1 3.5 3 330

; Play streson
i2 7.5 3 294

; Play resony
i3 11.5 2 523

; Play resonr
i4 14.5 2 392

; Play resonz
i5 17.5 2 659

; Play vlowrez
i6 20.5 3 220

; Play bell-like
i7 24.5 4 523

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates spectral filtering and processing
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

giSaw ftgen 1, 0, 16384, 10, 1, 0.5, 0.3, 0.25, 0.2, 0.16, 0.14, 0.12

instr 1
    ; pvsfilter opcode: fsig pvsfilter fsigin, fsigfilt, kdepth [, igain]
    ; pvsfilter filters spectrum using another spectrum as filter
    ; fsigin - input spectrum
    ; fsigfilt - filter spectrum
    ; kdepth - filter depth (0-1)
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Source signal (sawtooth)
    aSource poscil iAmp, iFreq, giSaw
    
    ; Filter modulator (sine)
    aFilt poscil 0.5, iFreq*0.5, 1
    
    ; Analyze both
    fSource pvsanal aSource, 2048, 256, 2048, 1
    fFilt pvsanal aFilt, 2048, 256, 2048, 1
    
    ; Apply spectral filter
    kDepth = 0.8
    fFiltered pvsfilter fSource, fFilt, kDepth
    
    ; Resynthesize
    aOut pvsynth fFiltered
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

instr 2
    ; pvsmooth opcode: fsig pvsmooth fsigin, kacf, kfcf
    ; pvsmooth smooths spectral data
    ; fsigin - input spectrum
    ; kacf - amplitude coefficient (0-1)
    ; kfcf - frequency coefficient (0-1)
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Rich source
    aSource poscil iAmp, iFreq, giSaw
    
    ; Analyze
    fSig pvsanal aSource, 2048, 256, 2048, 1
    
    ; Smooth
    kAmpSmooth = 0.5
    kFreqSmooth = 0.7
    fSmooth pvsmooth fSig, kAmpSmooth, kFreqSmooth
    
    ; Resynthesize
    aOut pvsynth fSmooth
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

instr 3
    ; pvsblur opcode: fsig pvsblur fsigin, kblurtime, imaxdelay
    ; pvsblur blurs spectrum over time
    ; fsigin - input spectrum
    ; kblurtime - blur time in seconds
    ; imaxdelay - maximum delay time
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Source
    aSource poscil iAmp, iFreq, giSaw
    
    ; Analyze
    fSig pvsanal aSource, 2048, 256, 2048, 1
    
    ; Blur
    kBlurTime = 0.2
    fBlur pvsblur fSig, kBlurTime, 2
    
    ; Resynthesize
    aOut pvsynth fBlur
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

instr 4
    ; pvsfreeze opcode: fsig pvsfreeze fsigin, kfreeza, kfreezf
    ; pvsfreeze freezes spectral components
    ; fsigin - input spectrum
    ; kfreeza - freeze amplitudes (0=no freeze, 1=freeze)
    ; kfreezf - freeze frequencies (0=no freeze, 1=freeze)
    
    iAmp = 0.4
    iFreq = p4
    
    ; Source
    aSource poscil iAmp, iFreq, giSaw
    
    ; Analyze
    fSig pvsanal aSource, 2048, 256, 2048, 1
    
    ; Freeze after 1 second
    kFreezeAmp linseg 0, 1, 0, 0.1, 1, p3-1.1, 1
    kFreezeFreq = kFreezeAmp
    
    fFreeze pvsfreeze fSig, kFreezeAmp, kFreezeFreq
    
    ; Resynthesize
    aOut pvsynth fFreeze
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

instr 5
    ; pvsmix opcode: fsig pvsmix fsig1, fsig2
    ; pvsmix mixes two spectral signals
    ; fsig1, fsig2 - input spectra
    
    iAmp = 0.3
    iFreq1 = p4
    iFreq2 = p5
    
    ; Two sources
    aSource1 poscil iAmp, iFreq1, giSaw
    aSource2 poscil iAmp, iFreq2, 1
    
    ; Analyze
    fSig1 pvsanal aSource1, 2048, 256, 2048, 1
    fSig2 pvsanal aSource2, 2048, 256, 2048, 1
    
    ; Mix
    fMix pvsmix fSig1, fSig2
    
    ; Resynthesize
    aOut pvsynth fMix
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play spectral filter
i1 0 3 220

; Play spectral smooth
i2 4 3 330

; Play spectral blur
i3 8 4 440

; Play spectral freeze
i4 13 4 392

; Play spectral mix
; Format: start dur freq1 freq2
i5 18 3 220 330
i5 21 3 294 440

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the butbp opcode for second-order Butterworth band-pass filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 1
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; butbp opcode: ares butbp asig, kfreq, kband [, iskip]
    ; butbp is a second-order Butterworth band-pass filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfreq - center frequency in Hz
    ; kband - bandwidth in Hz
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate white noise
    aNoise noise kAmp, 0
    
    ; Sweep center frequency
    kCenter expseg 200, p3, 3000
    
    ; Fixed bandwidth
    kBW = 100
    
    ; Apply band-pass filter
    aFilt butbp aNoise, kCenter, kBW
    
    out aFilt * 3
endin

instr 2
    ; Create vowel-like formants
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 0
    
    ; Two formant filters for "ah" vowel
    kF1 = 730
    kF2 = 1090
    kBW = 80
    
    aForm1 butbp aSaw, kF1, kBW
    aForm2 butbp aSaw, kF2, kBW
    
    out (aForm1 + aForm2*0.7) * 2
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play sweeping bandpass on noise
i1 0 4
; Play formant filtering
i2 4.5 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the reson opcode for second-order resonant filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; reson opcode: ares reson asig, xcf, xbw [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; reson is a second-order resonant filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; xcf - center frequency in Hz
    ; xbw - bandwidth in Hz
    ; iscl - scaling flag (1=no scaling, 2=peak response)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.3, p3-0.1, 0.3, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Generate noise burst
    aNoise noise kAmp, 0
    
    ; Resonant filter at 440 Hz
    kCF = 440
    kBW = 20
    
    ; Apply reson filter
    aFilt reson aNoise, kCF, kBW, 2
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Plucked string simulation using impulse + reson
    kAmp = 0.5
    
    ; Single impulse at start
    aImp mpulse kAmp, 0
    
    ; Multiple resonant modes for string-like sound
    kFreq = 220
    aRes1 reson aImp, kFreq, 5, 2
    aRes2 reson aImp, kFreq*2, 8, 2
    aRes3 reson aImp, kFreq*3, 12, 2
    
    ; Decay envelope
    kEnv expseg 1, p3, 0.001
    
    aMix = (aRes1 + aRes2*0.5 + aRes3*0.3) * kEnv
    
    outs aMix*0.3, aMix*0.3
endin

instr 3
    ; Resonant sweep effect
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source

    ; Sweep resonant frequency
    kCF expseg 300, p3*0.5, 3000, p3*0.5, 400
    
    ; Narrow bandwidth for pronounced resonance
    kBW = 30
    
    aFilt reson aSaw, kCF, kBW, 2
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the resonk opcode for resonant filtering with k-rate frequency
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 1
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; resonk opcode: ares resonk asig, kcf, kbw [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; resonk is similar to reson but with explicit k-rate frequency control
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - center frequency in Hz (k-rate)
    ; kbw - bandwidth in Hz (k-rate)
    ; iscl - scaling flag
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate pulse train
    aPulse vco2 kAmp, 55, 10, 0.3
    
    ; LFO modulates filter frequency
    kLFO oscili 400, 2, 1
    kCF = 800 + kLFO
    
    ; Variable bandwidth
    kBW linseg 50, p3, 200
    
    ; Apply resonant filter
    aFilt resonk aPulse, kCF, kBW, 2
    
    out aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Step-wise frequency changes
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; White noise
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.3, 0
    
    ; Stepped center frequencies
    kTime timeinsts
    kCF init 300
    
    if kTime > p3*0.25 && kTime < p3*0.25+0.01 then
        kCF = 600
    elseif kTime > p3*0.5 && kTime < p3*0.5+0.01 then
        kCF = 1200
    elseif kTime > p3*0.75 && kTime < p3*0.75+0.01 then
        kCF = 400
    endif
    
    ; Fixed narrow bandwidth
    kBW = 40
    
    aFilt resonk aNoise, kCF, kBW, 2
    
    out aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>

f1 0 8192 10 1

; Play LFO modulation
i1 0 4
; Play stepped frequencies
i2 4.5 4

e
</CsScore>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the resonr opcode for resonant filtering with variable resonance
output:

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; resonr opcode: ares resonr asig, xcf, xbw, iscl [, iskip]
    ; resonr is a resonant filter with improved response
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; xcf - center frequency in Hz
    ; xbw - bandwidth in Hz
    ; iscl - scaling mode
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 165, 0
    
    ; Fixed center frequency
    kCF = 1200
    
    ; Sweep bandwidth (narrow to wide = high Q to low Q)
    kBW expseg 10, p3*0.5, 500, p3*0.5, 20
    
    ; Apply resonant filter
    aFiltL resonr aSaw, kCF, kBW, 2
    aFiltR resonr aSaw, kCF*1.01, kBW, 2
    
    outs aFiltL, aFiltR
endin

instr 2
    ; Bell-like sound using resonr
    kAmp expseg 0.001, 0.01, 0.4, p3-0.01, 0.001

    aImp mpulse kAmp, 0
    
    ; Multiple inharmonic resonances for bell timbre
    kCF1 = 440
    kCF2 = 440 * 2.76
    kCF3 = 440 * 5.4
    
    aRes1 resonr aImp, kCF1, 15, 2
    aRes2 resonr aImp, kCF2, 20, 2
    aRes3 resonr aImp, kCF3, 30, 2
    
    aMix = aRes1 + aRes2*0.6 + aRes3*0.3
    
    outs aMix*0.5, aMix*0.5
endin

instr 3
    ; Vocal formant synthesis
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.1, 0.7, 0.3
    
    ; Buzz source

    kF1 = 270
    kF2 = 2300
    kF3 = 3000
    
    aForm1 resonr aBuzz, kF1, 50, 2
    aForm2 resonr aBuzz, kF2, 100, 2
    aForm3 resonr aBuzz, kF3, 150, 2
    
    aMix = aForm1 + aForm2*0.5 + aForm3*0.3
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

</CsInstruments>

    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - base center frequency in Hz

    ; resonx emulates a second-order resonant filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; xcf - center frequency in Hz
    ; xbw - bandwidth in Hz
    ; inumlayer - number of layers (1-4)
    ; iscl - scaling flag

    ; Fixed frequency

    kBW = 25

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the tbvcf opcode for modeling a TB-303 voltage-controlled filter
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; tbvcf opcode: ares tbvcf asig, xfco, xres, kdist, kasym [, iskip]
    ; tbvcf models the TB-303 voltage-controlled filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; xfco - cutoff frequency in Hz
    ; xres - resonance (0-1, self-oscillates above ~0.95)
    ; kdist - distortion amount (0-inf, typically 0-2)
    ; kasym - asymmetry of distortion (0-1)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.05, 0.4, 0.2
    
    ; Classic TB-303 sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 82.41, 0
    
    ; Fast filter sweep (accent)
    kCutoff expseg 100, 0.05, 2000, 0.15, 300, p3-0.2, 150
    
    ; High resonance for squelchy sound
    kRes = 0.85
    
    ; Moderate distortion
    kDist = 0.5
    
    ; Slight asymmetry
    kAsym = 0.3
    
    ; Apply TB-303 filter
    aFilt tbvcf aSaw, kCutoff, kRes, kDist, kAsym
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Classic acid bassline pattern
    kAmp madsr 0.003, 0.03, 0.3, 0.15
    
    ; Get note frequency from score
    iFreq = p4
    iAccent = p5
    
    ; Sawtooth oscillator
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, iFreq, 0
    
    ; Filter envelope depends on accent
    iCutStart = (iAccent > 0) ? 150 : 100
    iCutPeak = (iAccent > 0) ? 3000 : 1500
    iCutEnd = (iAccent > 0) ? 400 : 200
    
    kCutoff expseg iCutStart, 0.04, iCutPeak, 0.12, iCutEnd, p3-0.16, iCutStart
    
    ; Resonance
    kRes = 0.88
    
    ; Distortion
    kDist = 0.4
    kAsym = 0.2
    
    aFilt tbvcf aSaw, kCutoff, kRes, kDist, kAsym
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Self-oscillation demonstration
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.2, p3-0.2, 0.2, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Low-level noise input
    aNoise noise 0.01, 0
    
    ; Sweep cutoff for self-oscillation pitch
    kCutoff linseg 200, p3, 1000
    
    ; Very high resonance (self-oscillates)
    kRes = 0.98
    
    ; No distortion for pure tone
    kDist = 0
    kAsym = 0
    
    aFilt tbvcf aNoise, kCutoff, kRes, kDist, kAsym
    
    outs aFilt*kAmp, aFilt*kAmp
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play accented note
i1 0 1.5

; Acid bassline pattern (freq, accent)
; Note: p4=frequency, p5=accent(0 or 1)
i2 2    0.5  82.41  1   ; C accented
i2 2.5  0.25 82.41  0   ; C
i2 2.75 0.25 110.00 0   ; A
i2 3    0.5  146.83 1   ; D accented
i2 3.5  0.5  110.00 0   ; A
i2 4    0.5  82.41  1   ; C accented
i2 4.5  0.5  73.42  0   ; D
i2 5    1.0  65.41  1   ; C accented

; Self-oscillation
i3 6.5 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the butbr opcode for second-order Butterworth band-reject filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 1
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; butbr opcode: ares butbr asig, kfreq, kband [, iskip]
    ; butbr is a second-order Butterworth band-reject (notch) filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfreq - center frequency to reject (in Hz)
    ; kband - bandwidth of rejection (in Hz)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate signal with multiple harmonics
    aSig1 poscil kAmp*0.3, 220, giSine
    aSig2 poscil kAmp*0.25, 440, giSine
    aSig3 poscil kAmp*0.2, 660, giSine
    aSig4 poscil kAmp*0.15, 880, giSine
    aMix = aSig1 + aSig2 + aSig3 + aSig4
    
    ; Notch out 440 Hz (remove second harmonic)
    kNotchFreq = 440
    kBW = 20
    
    ; Apply band-reject filter
    aFilt butbr aMix, kNotchFreq, kBW
    
    out aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Remove specific frequency from noise
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.3
    
    ; Generate white noise
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.4, 0
    
    ; Sweep notch frequency
    kNotchFreq expseg 200, p3, 2000
    
    ; Narrow notch
    kBW = 30
    
    ; Apply notch filter
    aFilt butbr aNoise, kNotchFreq, kBW
    
    out aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Multiple notch filters for comb-like effect
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.4, p3-0.1, 0.4, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Bright sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 165, 0
    
    ; Apply multiple notches at harmonic intervals
    kBase = 550
    kBW = 40
    
    ; First notch
    aFilt butbr aSaw, kBase, kBW
    ; Second notch
    aFilt butbr aFilt, kBase*2, kBW
    ; Third notch
    aFilt butbr aFilt, kBase*3, kBW
    
    out aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play harmonic removal
i1 0 3
; Play sweeping notch on noise
i2 3.5 4
; Play multiple notches
i3 8 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

    ; areson opcode: ares areson asig, kcf, kbw [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; areson is a second-order band-reject (notch) filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - center frequency to reject (in Hz)
    ; kbw - bandwidth in Hz
    ; iscl - scaling flag (optional)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)

    aSig1 poscil kAmp*0.25, 200, giSine

    aSig3 poscil kAmp*0.15, 600, giSine
    aSig4 poscil kAmp*0.12, 800, giSine
    aSig5 poscil kAmp*0.1, 1000, giSine
    aMix = aSig1 + aSig2 + aSig3 + aSig4 + aSig5
    
    ; Notch out 600 Hz
    kNotchFreq = 600
    kBW = 25

    kBW = 80
    
    ; Apply multiple notches
    aFilt areson aBuzz, kNotch1, kBW
    aFilt areson aFilt, kNotch2, kBW
    
    out aFilt

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the areson opcode for creating comb-filter effects
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; areson opcode: ares areson asig, kcf, kbw [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; Create comb-like filtering with multiple notches
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - center frequency to reject
    ; kbw - bandwidth
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate noise
    aNoise noise kAmp, 0
    
    ; Create harmonic series of notches
    kBase = 200
    kBW = 20
    
    ; Apply multiple notches at harmonic intervals
    aFilt = aNoise
    iNotch = 1
    while iNotch <= 8 do
        aFilt areson aFilt, kBase*iNotch, kBW
        iNotch += 1
    od
    
    outs aFilt*2, aFilt*2
endin

instr 2
    ; Dynamic comb filter with variable spacing
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Square wave source
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.25, 165, 2
    
    ; Variable notch spacing
    kSpacing linseg 150, p3, 400
    kBW = 30
    
    ; Apply 6 notches with variable spacing
    aFilt = aSq
    iNotch = 1
    while iNotch <= 6 do
        aFilt areson aFilt, kSpacing*iNotch, kBW
        iNotch += 1
    od
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Metallic/robotic effect
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Voice-like buzz
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 180, 25, giSine
    
    ; Inharmonic notch series for metallic timbre
    kNotches[] fillarray 317, 689, 1123, 1847, 2456
    kBW = 50
    
    ; Apply each notch
    aFilt = aBuzz
    iCount = 0
    while iCount < lenarray(kNotches) do
        aFilt areson aFilt, kNotches[iCount], kBW
        iCount += 1
    od
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 4
    ; Phasing/flanging effect with moving notches
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Rich sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 0
    
    ; LFO modulates notch positions
    kLFO oscili 300, 0.4, giSine
    
    kBW = 40
    
    ; Multiple notches move together
    aFilt = aSaw
    iNotch = 1
    while iNotch <= 5 do
        kNotchFreq = 400*iNotch + kLFO
        aFilt areson aFilt, kNotchFreq, kBW
        iNotch += 1
    od
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play harmonic comb filter
i1 0 4
; Play variable spacing
i2 4.5 4
; Play metallic effect
i3 9 3
; Play phasing effect
i4 12.5 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates using butbr for precise frequency notching in subtractive synthesis
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sawtooth
giSaw ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0.5, 0.333, 0.25, 0.2, 0.166, 0.142, 0.125

instr 1
    ; butbr opcode: ares butbr asig, kfreq, kband [, iskip]
    ; Sculpt timbre by removing specific frequency ranges
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfreq - center frequency to reject
    ; kband - bandwidth
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Detuned sawtooth oscillators
    aSaw1 poscil kAmp*0.2, 110, giSaw
    aSaw2 poscil kAmp*0.2, 110.5, giSaw
    aMix = aSaw1 + aSaw2
    
    ; Remove specific harmonics to create unique timbre
    ; Remove 3rd harmonic region
    aFilt butbr aMix, 330, 40
    ; Remove 7th harmonic region
    aFilt butbr aFilt, 770, 50
    
    ; Apply low-pass to smooth
    aFilt tone aFilt, 2000
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Hollowed-out bass sound
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.08, 0.5, 0.25
    
    ; Low frequency sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.35, 55, 0
    
    ; Remove mid-range to create "scooped" bass
    aFilt butbr aSaw, 350, 200
    aFilt butbr aFilt, 800, 250
    
    ; Boost highs with resonant filter
    aRes reson aFilt, 2500, 200, 2
    aRes balance aRes, aFilt
    
    aMix = aFilt + aRes*0.3
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

instr 3
    ; Nasal/telephone quality by removing frequencies
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Buzz source
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 150, 30, 1
    
    ; Remove very low and very high, keep mid
    ; This creates telephone-like bandpass effect via notches
    aFilt butbr aBuzz, 100, 80   ; Remove lows
    aFilt butbr aFilt, 3500, 1000 ; Remove highs
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 4
    ; Animated timbre with moving notches
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; Complex waveform
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.15, 220, 0
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.15, 220.3, 2
    aMix = aSaw + aSq
    
    ; Two independent LFOs control notch positions
    kLFO1 oscili 500, 0.3, 1
    kLFO2 oscili 700, 0.47, 1
    
    kNotch1 = 600 + kLFO1
    kNotch2 = 1400 + kLFO2
    
    aFilt butbr aMix, kNotch1, 60
    aFilt butbr aFilt, kNotch2, 80
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Cosine for buzz
f1 0 8192 11 1

; Play harmonic sculpting
i1 0 3
i1 1 3
i1 2 3

; Play scooped bass
i2 5 2.5
i2 6 2.5

; Play telephone effect
i3 9 3

; Play animated notches
i4 12.5 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the vcomb opcode for time-varying comb filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; vcomb opcode: ares vcomb asig, krvt, xlpt, imaxlpt [, iskip] [, insmps]
    ; vcomb is a comb filter with variable delay time
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; krvt - reverberation time
    ; xlpt - loop time (can be k-rate or a-rate)
    ; imaxlpt - maximum loop time
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    ; insmps - use samples instead of seconds (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.01, 0.5, p3-0.2, 0.5, 0.19, 0
    
    ; Impulse train as excitation
    aExcite mpulse kAmp*0.6, 8
    
    ; Sweep the comb frequency (pitch bend effect)
    kLoopTime linseg 1/220, p3, 1/440
    kRvt = 2
    iMaxLoop = 1/100  ; Maximum delay time
    
    ; Apply variable comb filter
    aRes vcomb aExcite, kRvt, kLoopTime, iMaxLoop
    
    outs aRes, aRes
endin

instr 2
    ; Vibrato effect with vcomb
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Noise excitation
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.4, 0
    aExcite = aNoise * (1 - linseg(0, 0.05, 1, 0.01, 1))
    
    ; Base frequency
    iBaseFreq = 330
    iBaseLoop = 1/iBaseFreq
    
    ; Add vibrato with LFO
    kVib oscili 0.002, 5, giSine
    kLoopTime = iBaseLoop + kVib
    
    kRvt = 2.5
    iMaxLoop = 1/100
    
    aComb vcomb aExcite, kRvt, kLoopTime, iMaxLoop
    
    outs aComb*0.6, aComb*0.6
endin

instr 3
    ; Doppler-like pitch shifting
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.4, p3-0.1, 0.4, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Continuous excitation
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.3, 0
    
    ; Rapid pitch change (like passing by)
    kLoopTime expseg 1/600, p3*0.3, 1/200, p3*0.7, 1/800
    
    kRvt = 1.5
    iMaxLoop = 1/100
    
    aComb vcomb aNoise, kRvt, kLoopTime, iMaxLoop
    
    outs aComb, aComb
endin

instr 4
    ; Flanging effect using vcomb
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Rich sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 0
    
    ; Very short, modulated delay for flanging
    kLFO oscili 0.005, 0.3, giSine
    kLoopTime = 0.008 + kLFO
    
    kRvt = 0.3
    iMaxLoop = 0.02
    
    aFlange vcomb aSaw, kRvt, kLoopTime, iMaxLoop
    
    ; Mix wet and dry
    aMix = aSaw*0.5 + aFlange*0.5
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play pitch sweep
i1 0 4

; Play vibrato
i2 4.5 3

; Play doppler effect
i3 8 3

; Play flanging
i4 11.5 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the alpass opcode for allpass filtering in reverb design
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; alpass opcode: ares alpass asig, krvt, ilpt [, iskip] [, insmps]
    ; alpass is an allpass filter with a fixed delay time
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; krvt - reverberation time
    ; ilpt - loop time (delay time in seconds)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    ; insmps - loop time in samples (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 0.3
    
    ; Simple tone to process
    aOsc poscil kAmp*0.3, 440, giSine
    
    ; Single allpass filter
    ; Allpass filters pass all frequencies but change phase relationships
    iLoopTime = 0.03  ; 30ms delay
    kRvt = 1.5
    
    aAP alpass aOsc, kRvt, iLoopTime
    
    outs aOsc*0.5, aAP*0.5
endin

instr 2
    ; Simple reverb using series allpass filters
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.08, 0.4, 0.4
    
    ; Percussive sound
    aPluck pluck kAmp*0.4, 330, 330, 0, 1
    
    ; Classic Schroeder reverb topology: 4 allpass filters in series
    aAP1 alpass aPluck, 1.5, 0.0297
    aAP2 alpass aAP1, 1.5, 0.0371
    aAP3 alpass aAP2, 1.5, 0.0411
    aAP4 alpass aAP3, 1.5, 0.0437
    
    ; Mix dry and wet
    aLeft = aPluck*0.4 + aAP4*0.6
    aRight = aPluck*0.4 + aAP4*0.6
    
    outs aLeft, aRight
endin

instr 3
    ; Dense reverb with parallel and series allpass
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.01, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.19, 0
    
    ; Impulse excitation
    aImp mpulse kAmp, 0
    
    ; First stage: parallel allpass filters
    aAP1a alpass aImp, 1.0, 0.023
    aAP1b alpass aImp, 1.0, 0.031
    aPara = (aAP1a + aAP1b) * 0.5
    
    ; Second stage: series allpass filters
    aAP2 alpass aPara, 1.8, 0.041
    aAP3 alpass aAP2, 1.8, 0.053
    aAP4 alpass aAP3, 1.8, 0.067
    
    outs aAP4, aAP4
endin

instr 4
    ; Diffusion network for room simulation
    kAmp madsr 0.002, 0.05, 0.3, 0.5
    
    ; Hand clap (noise burst)
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.5, 0
    aClap = aNoise * (1 - linseg(0, 0.02, 1, 0.001, 1))
    
    ; Dense diffusion using multiple allpass stages
    ; Short delays for early reflections
    aAP1 alpass aClap, 0.8, 0.0051
    aAP2 alpass aAP1, 0.8, 0.0071
    aAP3 alpass aAP2, 0.8, 0.0093
    aAP4 alpass aAP3, 0.8, 0.0113
    
    ; Longer delays for late reverb
    aAP5 alpass aAP4, 2.0, 0.0371
    aAP6 alpass aAP5, 2.0, 0.0479
    
    ; Stereo spread
    aLeft = aClap*0.3 + aAP6*0.7
    aRight = aClap*0.3 + aAP4*0.4 + aAP6*0.6
    
    outs aLeft, aRight
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play basic allpass
i1 0 2

; Play simple reverb
i2 3 2
i2 4 2
i2 5 2

; Play dense reverb
i3 7.5 3

; Play diffusion
i4 11 2
i4 12 2

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the valpass opcode for time-varying allpass filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; valpass opcode: ares valpass asig, krvt, xlpt, imaxlpt [, iskip] [, insmps]
    ; valpass is an allpass filter with variable delay time
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; krvt - reverberation time
    ; xlpt - loop time (can be k-rate or a-rate)
    ; imaxlpt - maximum loop time
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    ; insmps - use samples instead of seconds (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 0.3
    
    ; Source oscillator
    aOsc poscil kAmp*0.3, 330, giSine
    
    ; Sweep allpass delay time
    kLoopTime linseg 0.01, p3, 0.08
    kRvt = 1.0
    iMaxLoop = 0.1
    
    ; Apply variable allpass filter
    aAP valpass aOsc, kRvt, kLoopTime, iMaxLoop
    
    outs aOsc*0.4, aAP*0.6
endin

instr 2
    ; Phaser effect using modulated valpass
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Rich sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 0
    
    ; LFO modulates allpass delay
    kLFO oscili 0.008, 0.4, giSine
    kLoopTime = 0.015 + kLFO
    
    kRvt = 0.5
    iMaxLoop = 0.03
    
    ; Multiple stages for deeper phasing
    aAP1 valpass aSaw, kRvt, kLoopTime, iMaxLoop
    aAP2 valpass aAP1, kRvt, kLoopTime*1.3, iMaxLoop
    aAP3 valpass aAP2, kRvt, kLoopTime*1.7, iMaxLoop
    
    ; Mix with dry signal
    aMix = aSaw*0.4 + aAP3*0.6
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

instr 3
    ; Dynamic reverb with changing room size
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.01, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.19, 0
    
    ; Percussive click
    aClick mpulse kAmp*0.5, p3/8
    
    ; Room size changes over time
    kRoomSize linseg 0.02, p3, 0.09
    kRvt = 2.5
    iMaxLoop = 0.1
    
    ; Series of allpass filters with changing delays
    aAP1 valpass aClick, kRvt, kRoomSize*0.5, iMaxLoop
    aAP2 valpass aAP1, kRvt, kRoomSize*0.7, iMaxLoop
    aAP3 valpass aAP2, kRvt, kRoomSize*0.9, iMaxLoop
    aAP4 valpass aAP3, kRvt, kRoomSize, iMaxLoop
    
    ; Stereo output
    aLeft = aClick*0.2 + aAP4*0.8
    aRight = aClick*0.2 + aAP3*0.6 + aAP4*0.4
    
    outs aLeft, aRight
endin

instr 4
    ; Chorus effect using short valpass filters
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.12, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; String-like tone
    aSaw1 vco2 kAmp*0.15, 110, 0
    aSaw2 vco2 kAmp*0.15, 110.2, 0
    aMix = aSaw1 + aSaw2
    
    ; Two independent LFOs
    kLFO1 oscili 0.004, 0.7, giSine
    kLFO2 oscili 0.005, 0.53, giSine
    
    kLoop1 = 0.025 + kLFO1
    kLoop2 = 0.032 + kLFO2
    
    kRvt = 0.3
    iMaxLoop = 0.05
    
    ; Two voices for stereo chorus
    aLeft valpass aMix, kRvt, kLoop1, iMaxLoop
    aRight valpass aMix, kRvt, kLoop2, iMaxLoop
    
    ; Blend with dry
    aLeft = aMix*0.5 + aLeft*0.5
    aRight = aMix*0.5 + aRight*0.5
    
    outs aLeft, aRight
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play sweeping allpass
i1 0 4

; Play phaser
i2 4.5 5

; Play dynamic reverb
i3 10 5

; Play chorus
i4 15.5 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates using comb and alpass filters together for realistic reverberation
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; Combine comb and alpass for Schroeder reverb
    ; This is a classic reverb topology
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.003, 0.05, 0.3, 0.4
    
    ; Dry signal - short pluck
    aPluck pluck kAmp*0.4, p4, p4, 0, 1
    
    ; Parallel comb filters (resonators)
    kRvt = 2.5
    aComb1 comb aPluck, kRvt, 0.0297
    aComb2 comb aPluck, kRvt, 0.0371
    aComb3 comb aPluck, kRvt, 0.0411
    aComb4 comb aPluck, kRvt, 0.0437
    
    ; Sum parallel combs
    aCombSum = (aComb1 + aComb2 + aComb3 + aComb4) * 0.25
    
    ; Series allpass filters (diffusion)
    aAP1 alpass aCombSum, 1.5, 0.0050
    aAP2 alpass aAP1, 1.5, 0.0017
    
    ; Mix dry and reverb
    aLeft = aPluck*0.3 + aAP2*0.7
    aRight = aPluck*0.3 + aAP1*0.5 + aAP2*0.5
    
    outs aLeft, aRight
endin

instr 2
    ; Large hall reverb with extended decay
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.01, 0.25, p3-0.2, 0.25, 0.19, 0
    
    ; Hand clap excitation
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.6, 0
    aExcite = aNoise * (1 - linseg(0, 0.015, 1, 0.001, 1))
    
    ; Early reflections (short combs)
    kRvtEarly = 0.8
    aComb1 comb aExcite, kRvtEarly, 0.0133
    aComb2 comb aExcite, kRvtEarly, 0.0157
    aComb3 comb aExcite, kRvtEarly, 0.0179
    aComb4 comb aExcite, kRvtEarly, 0.0211
    aEarly = (aComb1 + aComb2 + aComb3 + aComb4) * 0.25
    
    ; Late reverberation (longer combs)
    kRvtLate = 4.0
    aComb5 comb aEarly, kRvtLate, 0.0451
    aComb6 comb aEarly, kRvtLate, 0.0503
    aComb7 comb aEarly, kRvtLate, 0.0571
    aComb8 comb aEarly, kRvtLate, 0.0613
    aLate = (aComb5 + aComb6 + aComb7 + aComb8) * 0.25
    
    ; Diffusion stage
    aAP1 alpass aLate, 2.5, 0.0071
    aAP2 alpass aAP1, 2.5, 0.0093
    aAP3 alpass aAP2, 2.5, 0.0113
    
    ; Stereo placement
    aLeft = aExcite*0.15 + aEarly*0.25 + aAP3*0.6
    aRight = aExcite*0.15 + aEarly*0.3 + aAP2*0.4 + aAP3*0.5
    
    outs aLeft, aRight
endin

instr 3
    ; Modulated reverb with vcomb and valpass
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.4, 0.5
    
    ; Source tone
    aOsc poscil kAmp*0.25, 220, giSine
    
    ; LFO for modulation
    kLFO oscili 0.003, 0.25, giSine
    
    ; Variable comb filters
    kLoop1 = 0.037 + kLFO
    kLoop2 = 0.043 + kLFO*1.3
    kRvt = 3.0
    
    aComb1 vcomb aOsc, kRvt, kLoop1, 0.05
    aComb2 vcomb aOsc, kRvt, kLoop2, 0.05
    aCombSum = (aComb1 + aComb2) * 0.5
    
    ; Variable allpass diffusion
    kAPLoop = 0.015 + kLFO*0.5
    aAP1 valpass aCombSum, 1.5, kAPLoop, 0.03
    aAP2 valpass aAP1, 1.5, kAPLoop*1.4, 0.03
    
    ; Output
    aMix = aOsc*0.2 + aAP2*0.8
    
    outs aMix, aMix
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play Schroeder reverb at different pitches
i1 0 3 330
i1 1.5 3 440
i1 3 3 550

; Play large hall
i2 7 4
i2 9 4

; Play modulated reverb
i3 13 6

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the combinv opcode for inverse comb filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; combinv opcode: ares combinv asig, krvt, ilpt [, iskip] [, insmps]
    ; combinv is an inverse comb filter (feedforward instead of feedback)
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; krvt - reverberation time (affects gain of delayed signal)
    ; ilpt - loop time (delay time in seconds)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    ; insmps - loop time in samples (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate sawtooth wave
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 220, 0
    
    ; Apply inverse comb filter
    ; Creates notches in the frequency spectrum
    iLoopTime = 1/440  ; Creates notch at 440 Hz and harmonics
    kRvt = 0.5
    
    aFilt combinv aSaw, kRvt, iLoopTime
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Spectral notching demonstration
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Bright source (square wave)
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.3, 165, 2
    
    ; Multiple inverse combs for complex filtering
    ; Each creates notches at different frequencies
    aFilt1 combinv aSq, 0.6, 1/330
    aFilt2 combinv aFilt1, 0.5, 1/550
    aFilt3 combinv aFilt2, 0.4, 1/770
    
    outs aFilt3, aFilt3
endin

instr 3
    ; Phaser-like effect with combinv
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.12, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; Rich sawtooth
    aSaw1 vco2 kAmp*0.2, 110, 0
    aSaw2 vco2 kAmp*0.2, 110.3, 0
    aMix = aSaw1 + aSaw2
    
    ; Short delay times for phasing effect
    iLoop1 = 0.003
    iLoop2 = 0.005
    
    kRvt = 0.7
    
    aFiltL combinv aMix, kRvt, iLoop1
    aFiltR combinv aMix, kRvt, iLoop2
    
    outs aFiltL, aFiltR
endin

instr 4
    ; Resonator removal (inverse of comb resonator)
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Noise source
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.5, 0
    
    ; Apply inverse comb to remove resonances
    ; Useful for reducing ringing in signals
    iLoop = 1/523  ; Remove resonance at 523 Hz
    kRvt = 0.8
    
    aFilt combinv aNoise, kRvt, iLoop
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 5
    ; Compare comb vs inverse comb
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.08, 0.5, 0.3
    
    ; Impulse excitation
    aImp mpulse kAmp*0.5, 4
    
    ; Regular comb filter (adds resonances)
    iLoop = 1/330
    kRvt = 1.5
    aComb comb aImp, kRvt, iLoop
    
    ; Inverse comb filter (creates notches)
    aInvComb combinv aImp, kRvt, iLoop
    
    ; Output regular comb to left, inverse to right
    outs aComb*0.6, aInvComb*0.6
endin

instr 6
    ; Harmonic filtering with combinv
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Pulse wave with many harmonics
    aPulse vco2 kAmp, 110, 10, 0.2
    
    ; Remove every other harmonic using inverse comb
    ; Loop time at twice the fundamental
    iLoop = 1/(110*2)
    kRvt = 0.9
    
    aFilt combinv aPulse, kRvt, iLoop
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play basic inverse comb filtering
i1 0 3

; Play spectral notching
i2 3.5 3

; Play phaser effect
i3 7 4

; Play resonance removal
i4 11.5 3

; Compare comb vs inverse comb
i5 15 4

; Play harmonic filtering
