instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the fofilter opcode for formant filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; fofilter opcode: ares fofilter asig, kcf, kris, kdec [, istor]
    ; fofilter filters a signal through FOF-like formant filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - center frequency (formant frequency in Hz)
    ; kris - impulse rise time (seconds)
    ; kdec - impulse decay time (seconds)
    ; istor - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 150, 0
    
    ; Single formant filter
    kFormant = 800
    kRis = 0.003
    kDec = 0.02
    
    ; Apply formant filter
    aFilt fofilter aSaw, kFormant, kRis, kDec
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Vowel filtering with multiple fofilters
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Buzz source (vocal cord simulation)
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 120, 40, giSine
    
    ; Vowel "ah" formants
    kF1 = 730
    kF2 = 1090
    kF3 = 2440
    
    kRis = 0.003
    kDec1 = 0.02
    kDec2 = 0.015
    kDec3 = 0.01
    
    ; Apply three formant filters
    aForm1 fofilter aBuzz, kF1, kRis, kDec1
    aForm2 fofilter aBuzz, kF2, kRis, kDec2
    aForm3 fofilter aBuzz, kF3, kRis, kDec3
    
    ; Mix with appropriate levels
    aVowel = aForm1*0.6 + aForm2*0.3 + aForm3*0.15
    
    outs aVowel, aVowel
endin

instr 3
    ; Dynamic formant sweeping
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 110, 0
    
    ; Sweep formant frequency
    kFormant expseg 300, p3, 2500
    kRis = 0.003
    kDec = 0.015
    
    aFilt fofilter aSaw, kFormant, kRis, kDec
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 4
    ; Vowel morphing with fofilter
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.12, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; Pulse source
    aPulse vco2 kAmp*0.3, 140, 2, 0.5
    
    ; Morph from "ee" to "oo"
    ; "ee": F1=270, F2=2290
    ; "oo": F1=300, F2=870
    kMorph linseg 0, p3, 1
    
    kF1 = 270 + (300-270)*kMorph
    kF2 = 2290 + (870-2290)*kMorph
    
    kRis = 0.003
    kDec = 0.018
    
    aForm1 fofilter aPulse, kF1, kRis, kDec
    aForm2 fofilter aPulse, kF2, kRis, kDec*0.8
    
    aVowel = aForm1*0.7 + aForm2*0.3
    
    outs aVowel, aVowel
endin

instr 5
    ; Talking drum effect
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.01, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.19, 0
    
    ; Noise burst (drum hit)
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.5, 0
    aExcite = aNoise * (1 - linseg(0, 0.03, 1, 0.001, 1))
    
    ; Varying formant simulates talking
    kFormant linseg 400, p3*0.3, 800, p3*0.4, 600, p3*0.3, 1000
    kRis = 0.002
    kDec = 0.025
    
    aFilt fofilter aExcite, kFormant, kRis, kDec
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play single formant
i1 0 2

; Play vowel "ah"
i2 2.5 3

; Play sweep
i3 6 4

; Play vowel morph
i4 10.5 4

; Play talking drum
i5 15 1.5
i5 16 1.5
i5 17 1.5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the resonz opcode for narrow-band formant filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; resonz opcode: ares resonz asig, kcf, kbw [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; resonz is a narrow-band bandpass filter useful for formants
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - center frequency (Hz)
    ; kbw - bandwidth (Hz)
    ; iscl - scale flag (1=no scaling, 2=peak response of 1)
    ; iskip - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 165, 0
    
    ; Single formant filter
    kCenter = 900
    kBW = 50
    iScl = 2  ; Peak response of 1
    
    ; Apply resonant filter
    aFilt resonz aSaw, kCenter, kBW, iScl
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Vowel synthesis with multiple resonz filters
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Buzz source
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 140, 35, giSine
    
    ; Vowel "eh" formants
    kF1 = 530
    kF2 = 1840
    kF3 = 2480
    
    kBW1 = 60
    kBW2 = 90
    kBW3 = 120
    
    ; Apply formant filters
    aForm1 resonz aBuzz, kF1, kBW1, 2
    aForm2 resonz aBuzz, kF2, kBW2, 2
    aForm3 resonz aBuzz, kF3, kBW3, 2
    
    ; Mix with formant amplitude levels
    aVowel = aForm1*0.6 + aForm2*0.35 + aForm3*0.15
    
    outs aVowel, aVowel
endin

instr 3
    ; Formant sweeping for vocal effects
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Square wave source
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.25, 110, 2
    
    ; Sweep two formants in opposite directions
    kF1 linseg 400, p3, 1200
    kF2 linseg 1800, p3, 800
    
    kBW1 = 70
    kBW2 = 90
    
    aForm1 resonz aSq, kF1, kBW1, 2
    aForm2 resonz aSq, kF2, kBW2, 2
    
    ; Stereo output
    outs aForm1*0.6, aForm2*0.6
endin

instr 4
    ; Parallel formant bank for rich timbre
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.08, 0.5, 0.3
    
    ; White noise source
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.3, 0
    
    ; Create five formant peaks
    kF1 = 350
    kF2 = 700
    kF3 = 1050
    kF4 = 1400
    kF5 = 1750
    
    kBW = 40  ; Narrow bandwidth
    
    aForm1 resonz aNoise, kF1, kBW, 2
    aForm2 resonz aNoise, kF2, kBW, 2
    aForm3 resonz aNoise, kF3, kBW, 2
    aForm4 resonz aNoise, kF4, kBW, 2
    aForm5 resonz aNoise, kF5, kBW, 2
    
    ; Mix all formants
    aOut = (aForm1 + aForm2 + aForm3 + aForm4 + aForm5) * 0.4
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

instr 5
    ; Modulated formant for robot voice
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.12, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 0
    
    ; LFO modulates formant positions
    kLFO oscili 200, 0.5, giSine
    
    kF1 = 600 + kLFO
    kF2 = 1200 + kLFO*1.5
    kF3 = 2400 + kLFO*0.8
    
    kBW1 = 50
    kBW2 = 70
    kBW3 = 100
    
    aForm1 resonz aSaw, kF1, kBW1, 2
    aForm2 resonz aSaw, kF2, kBW2, 2
    aForm3 resonz aSaw, kF3, kBW3, 2
    
    aRobot = aForm1*0.5 + aForm2*0.3 + aForm3*0.2
    
    outs aRobot, aRobot
endin

instr 6
    ; Vocal tract resonance on percussive sound
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.01, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.19, 0
    
    ; Impulse excitation
    aImp mpulse kAmp*0.5, 0
    
    ; Formant filtering creates pitched percussion
    kFormant = p4
    kBW = 30
    
    aFilt resonz aImp, kFormant, kBW, 2
    
    ; Add some comb filtering
    aFilt = aFilt + comb(aFilt, 1.5, 1/kFormant)
    
    outs aFilt*0.5, aFilt*0.5
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play single formant
i1 0 2

; Play vowel "eh"
i2 2.5 3

; Play formant sweep
i3 6 4

; Play formant bank
i4 10.5 3

; Play robot voice
i5 14 4

; Play pitched percussion
i6 18.5 1 440
i6 19.5 1 550
i6 20.5 1 660

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the buthp opcode for second-order Butterworth high-pass filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 1
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; buthp opcode: ares buthp asig, kfreq [, iskip]
    ; buthp is a second-order Butterworth high-pass filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfreq - cutoff frequency in Hz
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate signal with low and high frequency content
    aLow poscil kAmp*0.5, 110, giSine
    aMid poscil kAmp*0.3, 440, giSine
    aHigh poscil kAmp*0.2, 1760, giSine
    aMix = aLow + aMid + aHigh
    
    ; Sweep high-pass cutoff frequency
    kCutoff linseg 100, p3, 1000
    
    ; Apply Butterworth high-pass filter
    aFilt buthp aMix, kCutoff
    
    out aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Remove low-frequency rumble from noise
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.3
    
    ; Generate noise with DC offset
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.4, 0
    
    ; Remove DC and very low frequencies
    aClean buthp aNoise, 50
    
    out aClean
endin

instr 3
    ; Create "thin" synth sound by filtering out bass
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.4, p3-0.1, 0.4, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Generate full-spectrum sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 220, 0
    
    ; High-pass to remove low frequencies
    kCutoff = 800
    aFilt buthp aSaw, kCutoff
    
    out aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play frequency sweep
i1 0 4
; Play filtered noise
i2 4.5 3
; Play thin synth
i3 8 2.5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the atone opcode for first-order recursive high-pass filtering to remove DC offset
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; atone opcode: ares atone asig, khp [, iskip]
    ; atone is a first-order recursive high-pass filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; khp - half-power point (cutoff frequency in Hz)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate signal with unwanted DC component
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 220, 0
    aSaw = aSaw + 0.15  ; Add DC offset
    
    ; Remove DC offset with very low cutoff
    aClean atone aSaw, 10
    
    outs aClean, aClean
endin

instr 2
    ; Emphasize high frequencies
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Generate triangle wave
    aTri vco2 kAmp*0.4, 330, 4
    
    ; Variable high-pass cutoff
    kCutoff linseg 50, p3, 600
    
    ; Apply high-pass filter
    aFilt atone aTri, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Create "telephone" effect by removing lows
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.4, p3-0.1, 0.4, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Voice-like buzz source
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 150, 15, 1
    
    ; High-pass to simulate telephone
    aHP atone aBuzz, 300
    
    outs aHP, aHP
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Cosine for buzz
f1 0 8192 11 1

; Play DC removal
i1 0 3
; Play variable high-pass
i2 3.5 3
; Play telephone effect
i3 7 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the atonex opcode for resistor-capacitor high-pass filter emulation
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: square wave
giSquare ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0, 0.333, 0, 0.2, 0, 0.142, 0, 0.111

instr 1
    ; atonex opcode: ares atonex asig, khp, inumlayer [, iskip]
    ; atonex emulates a resistor-capacitor high-pass filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; khp - half-power point (cutoff frequency in Hz)
    ; inumlayer - number of filter layers (1-4 for steeper slopes)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate square wave with rich harmonics
    aSq poscil kAmp, 165, giSquare
    
    ; Variable cutoff frequency
    kCutoff linseg 100, p3, 800
    
    ; Apply atonex with 2 layers for 12dB/octave slope
    aFiltL atonex aSq, kCutoff, 2
    aFiltR atonex aSq, kCutoff*1.01, 2
    
    outs aFiltL, aFiltR
endin

instr 2
    ; Steep high-pass filtering with 4 layers
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Full-spectrum sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.35, 220, 0
    
    ; Fixed cutoff
    kCutoff = 500
    
    ; 4-layer filter for steep 24dB/octave rolloff
    aFilt atonex aSaw, kCutoff, 4
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Compare different filter slopes
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.35, p3-0.2, 0.35, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Buzz with many harmonics
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 110, 30, 1
    
    ; Fixed cutoff at 300 Hz
    kCutoff = 300
    
    ; Time changes number of layers
    kTime timeinsts
    kLayers = (kTime < p3/3) ? 1 : (kTime < 2*p3/3) ? 2 : 4
    
    ; Apply filter with varying slope
    aFilt atonex aBuzz, kCutoff, kLayers
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 4
    ; Create bright metallic sound
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.05, 0.4, 0.2
    
    ; Multiple detuned oscillators
    aSaw1 vco2 kAmp*0.15, 440, 0
    aSaw2 vco2 kAmp*0.15, 442, 0
    aSaw3 vco2 kAmp*0.15, 438, 0
    aMix = aSaw1 + aSaw2 + aSaw3
    
    ; Aggressive high-pass to create thin, bright tone
    kCutoff = 1200
    aFilt atonex aMix, kCutoff, 3
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Cosine for buzz
f1 0 8192 11 1

; Play variable cutoff sweep
i1 0 4
; Play steep filtering
i2 4.5 3
; Play varying slope demonstration
i3 8 3
; Play metallic bright sound
i4 11.5 2

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates using atone for creating a bandpass effect by combining with low-pass filter
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 1
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; atone opcode: ares atone asig, khp [, iskip]
    ; Combine atone (high-pass) with tone (low-pass) to create bandpass
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; khp - half-power point for high-pass
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.4, p3-0.1, 0.4, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Generate white noise
    aNoise noise kAmp, 0
    
    ; High-pass cutoff (removes lows)
    kHPCutoff = 500
    
    ; Low-pass cutoff (removes highs)
    kLPCutoff = 2000
    
    ; Create bandpass by cascading filters
    aHP atone aNoise, kHPCutoff
    aBP tone aHP, kLPCutoff
    
    out aBP
endin

instr 2
    ; Sweeping bandpass effect
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.35, 110, 0
    
    ; Sweep the band center
    kCenter expseg 200, p3, 3000
    
    ; Bandwidth of ~2 octaves
    kHPCutoff = kCenter * 0.5
    kLPCutoff = kCenter * 2
    
    ; Create sweeping bandpass
    aHP atone aSaw, kHPCutoff
    aBP tone aHP, kLPCutoff
    
    out aBP
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play fixed bandpass on noise
i1 0 3
; Play sweeping bandpass
i2 3.5 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates buthp for creating hi-hat sounds by filtering white noise
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; buthp opcode: ares buthp asig, kfreq [, iskip]
    ; Create hi-hat sound using high-pass filtered noise
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfreq - cutoff frequency in Hz
    
    ; Sharp envelope for hi-hat
    kAmp expseg 0.001, 0.001, 0.6, p3-0.001, 0.001
    
    ; Generate white noise
    aNoise noise kAmp, 0
    
    ; High-pass filter to keep only high frequencies
    kCutoff = 7000
    aHP buthp aNoise, kCutoff
    
    ; Add slight resonance with bandpass
    aRes reson aHP, 9000, 1000
    aRes balance aRes, aHP
    
    ; Mix filtered signals
    aMix = aHP + aRes*0.3
    
    outs aMix*0.5, aMix*0.5
endin

instr 2
    ; Open hi-hat (longer decay)
    kAmp expseg 0.001, 0.002, 0.5, p3-0.002, 0.001
    
    ; White noise source
    aNoise noise kAmp, 0
    
    ; High-pass filtering
    kCutoff = 6000
    aHP buthp aNoise, kCutoff
    
    ; Multiple resonant peaks
    aRes1 reson aHP, 8000, 800
    aRes2 reson aHP, 11000, 1200
    aRes1 balance aRes1, aHP
    aRes2 balance aRes2, aHP
    
    aMix = aHP*0.5 + aRes1*0.3 + aRes2*0.2
    
    outs aMix*0.5, aMix*0.5
endin

instr 3
    ; Closed hi-hat (short, crisp)
    kAmp expseg 0.001, 0.001, 0.7, 0.05, 0.001
    
    ; Noise
    aNoise noise kAmp, 0
    
    ; Aggressive high-pass
    aHP buthp aNoise, 8000
    aHP buthp aHP, 5000
    
    ; Single resonance
    aRes reson aHP, 10000, 1500
    aRes balance aRes, aHP
    
    aMix = aHP*0.6 + aRes*0.4
    
    outs aMix*0.5, aMix*0.5
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Closed hi-hat pattern
i3 0 0.1
i3 0.25 0.1
i3 0.5 0.1
i3 0.75 0.1

; Open hi-hat
i2 1 0.3

; More closed
i3 1.5 0.1
i3 1.75 0.1

; Open again
i2 2 0.4

; Final closed
i3 2.5 0.1
i3 2.75 0.1

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the tone opcode for first-order recursive low-pass filtering

    ; tone opcode: ares tone asig, khp [, iskip]
    ; tone is a first-order recursive low-pass filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; khp - half-power point (cutoff frequency in Hz)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)

    out aFilt * kAmp

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the tonex opcode for emulating a resistor-capacitor low-pass filter
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: square wave
giSquare ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0, 0.333, 0, 0.2, 0, 0.142, 0, 0.111

instr 1
    ; tonex opcode: ares tonex asig, khp, inumlayer [, iskip]
    ; tonex emulates a resistor-capacitor low-pass filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; khp - half-power point (cutoff frequency in Hz)
    ; inumlayer - number of filter layers (1-4 for different slopes)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate square wave
    aSq poscil kAmp, 330, giSquare
    
    ; Variable cutoff frequency
    kCutoff linseg 500, p3, 3000
    
    ; Apply tonex with 2 layers for 12dB/octave slope
    aFilt tonex aSq, kCutoff, 2
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Compare different filter slopes
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Bright source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 0
    
    ; Fixed cutoff
    kCutoff = 1000
    
    ; 4-layer filter for steep rolloff
    aFilt tonex aSaw, kCutoff, 4
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play instrument 1 for 3 seconds
i1 0 3
; Play instrument 2 for 3 seconds
i2 3.5 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the atone opcode for first-order recursive high-pass filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 1
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; atone opcode: ares atone asig, khp [, iskip]
    ; atone is a first-order recursive high-pass filter (complement of tone)
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; khp - half-power point (cutoff frequency in Hz)
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate bass-heavy signal
    aLow poscil kAmp*0.6, 110, giSine
    aMid poscil kAmp*0.3, 440, giSine
    aHigh poscil kAmp*0.1, 1760, giSine
    aMix = aLow + aMid + aHigh
    
    ; Sweep high-pass cutoff
    kCutoff linseg 50, p3, 800
    
    ; Apply high-pass filter
    aFilt atone aMix, kCutoff
    
    out aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Remove DC offset and low rumble
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.7, 0.3
    
    ; Generate signal with DC offset
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.4, 220, 0
    aSaw = aSaw + 0.1
    
    ; Remove DC and low frequencies
    aClean atone aSaw, 20
    
    out aClean
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play instrument 1 for 4 seconds
i1 0 4
; Play instrument 2 for 3 seconds
i2 4.5 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the butlp opcode for second-order Butterworth low-pass filtering

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sawtooth
giSaw ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1, 0.5, 0.333, 0.25, 0.2, 0.166, 0.142, 0.125

instr 1
    ; butlp opcode: ares butlp asig, kfreq [, iskip]
    ; butlp is a second-order Butterworth low-pass filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfreq - cutoff frequency in Hz
    ; iskip - skip initialization flag (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate bright sawtooth
    aSaw poscil kAmp, 220, giSaw
    
    ; Sweep cutoff frequency
    kCutoff expseg 100, p3*0.6, 5000, p3*0.4, 200
    
    ; Apply Butterworth low-pass filter
    aFiltL butlp aSaw, kCutoff
    aFiltR butlp aSaw, kCutoff*1.01
    
    outs aFiltL, aFiltR
endin

instr 2
    ; Classic synth bass with resonant filter sweep

    aSaw2 vco2 kAmp*0.3, 55.5, 0
    aMix = aSaw1 + aSaw2
    
    ; Envelope-controlled filter
    kFiltEnv linseg 200, 0.05, 2000, p3-0.05, 200
    
    aFilt butlp aMix, kFiltEnv
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

e

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the lpf18 opcode for 18dB/octave low-pass filtering with resonance
output:

<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; lpf18 opcode: ares lpf18 asig, kfco, kres, kdist
    ; lpf18 is an 18dB/octave low-pass filter with resonance and distortion
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfco - cutoff frequency in Hz
    ; kres - resonance (0-1, self-oscillates at higher values)
    ; kdist - distortion amount (0-2)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.3, p3-0.1, 0.3, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Generate sawtooth wave
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 110, 0
    
    ; Sweep cutoff with envelope
    kCutoff expseg 200, 0.1, 4000, p3-0.1, 300
    
    ; Moderate resonance
    kRes = 0.7
    
    ; Light distortion
    kDist = 0.3
    
    ; Apply lpf18 filter
    aFilt lpf18 aSaw, kCutoff, kRes, kDist
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Acid bass with high resonance
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.05, 0.4, 0.2
    
    ; Sawtooth oscillator
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.4, 82.41, 0
    
    ; Fast filter sweep
    kCutoff expseg 100, 0.05, 3000, 0.2, 200, p3-0.25, 150
    
    ; High resonance for squelchy sound
    kRes = 0.85
    
    ; Some distortion
    kDist = 0.5
    
    aFilt lpf18 aSaw, kCutoff, kRes, kDist
    
    outs aFilt*0.7, aFilt*0.7
endin

instr 3
    ; Self-oscillation demonstration
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.2, p3-0.2, 0.2, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Low amplitude input (filter will self-oscillate)
    aNoise noise 0.01, 0
    
    ; Varying cutoff
    kCutoff linseg 200, p3, 2000
    
    ; Very high resonance (near self-oscillation)
    kRes = 0.95
    
    aFilt lpf18 aNoise, kCutoff, kRes, 0
    
    outs aFilt*kAmp, aFilt*kAmp
endin

</CsInstruments>

; Play filter sweep
i1 0 3
; Play acid bass
i2 3.5 2.5
; Play self-oscillation
i3 6.5 4

e

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the moogladder opcode for Moog ladder filter emulation
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>

-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; moogladder opcode: asig moogladder ain, kcf, kres [, istor]
    ; moogladder is an improved implementation of the Moog ladder filter
    ; ain - input audio signal
    ; kcf - cutoff frequency in Hz
    ; kres - resonance (0-1)
    ; istor - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate bright sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 220, 0
    
    ; Classic filter sweep
    kCutoff expseg 150, p3*0.3, 3000, p3*0.7, 200
    
    ; Resonance
    kRes = 0.75
    
    ; Apply Moog ladder filter
    aFiltL moogladder aSaw, kCutoff, kRes
    aFiltR moogladder aSaw, kCutoff*1.005, kRes
    
    outs aFiltL, aFiltR
endin

instr 2
    ; Classic Moog bass sound
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.05, 0.5, 0.3
    
    ; Dual detuned oscillators
    aSaw1 vco2 kAmp*0.25, 55, 0
    aSaw2 vco2 kAmp*0.25, 55.2, 0
    aMix = aSaw1 + aSaw2
    
    ; Envelope-controlled filter
    kFiltEnv expseg 200, 0.1, 2500, p3-0.1, 150
    
    ; Medium-high resonance
    kRes = 0.8
    
    aFilt moogladder aMix, kFiltEnv, kRes
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Lead sound with vibrato
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.2, 0.6, 0.4
    
    ; Vibrato
    kVib oscili 3, 5, 1
    kFreq = 440 + kVib
    
    ; Square and sawtooth mix
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.2, kFreq, 2
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.2, kFreq, 0
    aMix = aSq + aSaw
    
    ; Moderate filter setting
    kCutoff = 1800
    kRes = 0.6
    
    aFilt moogladder aMix, kCutoff, kRes
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play filter sweep
i1 0 4
; Play bass
i2 4.5 3
; Play lead
i3 8 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the moogvcf opcode for Moog voltage-controlled filter

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 1
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; moogvcf opcode: ares moogvcf asig, xfco, xres [, iscale, iskip]
    ; moogvcf is a digital implementation of the Moog VCF
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; xfco - cutoff frequency in Hz
    ; xres - resonance (0-1, typically 0-0.9)
    ; iscale - scaling factor (optional)
    ; iskip - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.3, p3-0.1, 0.3, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Generate pulse wave
    aPulse vco2 kAmp, 165, 10, 0.5
    
    ; LFO-modulated cutoff
    kLFO oscili 800, 0.5, 1
    kCutoff = 1000 + kLFO
    
    ; Resonance
    kRes = 0.7
    
    ; Apply moogvcf
    aFilt moogvcf aPulse, kCutoff, kRes
    
    out aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Sweeping resonance
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Bright sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 110, 0
    
    ; Fixed cutoff
    kCutoff = 1500
    
    ; Sweep resonance
    kRes linseg 0.1, p3*0.5, 0.85, p3*0.5, 0.2
    
    aFilt moogvcf aSaw, kCutoff, kRes
    
    out aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the moogvcf2 opcode for improved Moog voltage-controlled filter
output:

<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; moogvcf2 opcode: ares moogvcf2 asig, xfco, xres [, iscale, iskip]
    ; moogvcf2 is an improved version with better stability
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; xfco - cutoff frequency in Hz
    ; xres - resonance (0-1)
    ; iscale - scaling factor (optional)
    ; iskip - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate sawtooth with slight detuning
    aSaw1 vco2 kAmp, 220, 0
    aSaw2 vco2 kAmp, 220.5, 0
    aMix = (aSaw1 + aSaw2) * 0.5
    
    ; Exponential filter sweep
    kCutoff expseg 180, p3*0.4, 4000, p3*0.6, 250
    
    ; High resonance
    kRes = 0.82
    
    ; Apply improved Moog filter
    aFiltL moogvcf2 aMix, kCutoff, kRes
    aFiltR moogvcf2 aMix, kCutoff*1.01, kRes
    
    outs aFiltL, aFiltR
endin

instr 2
    ; Percussive bass with fast envelope
    kAmp expseg 0.4, 0.02, 0.35, p3-0.02, 0.001
    
    ; Low frequency oscillator
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 65, 0
    
    ; Fast filter decay
    kCutoff expseg 100, 0.03, 3000, p3-0.03, 100
    
    ; Very high resonance
    kRes = 0.88
    
    aFilt moogvcf2 aSaw, kCutoff, kRes
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Pad sound with slow modulation
    kAmp madsr 0.3, 0.5, 0.6, 0.8
    
    ; Mix of waveforms
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.15, 110, 0
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.15, 110.3, 2
    aTri vco2 kAmp*0.15, 55, 4
    aMix = aSaw + aSq + aTri
    
    ; Slow filter LFO
    kLFO oscili 600, 0.3, 1
    kCutoff = 800 + kLFO
    
    kRes = 0.65
    
    aFilt moogvcf2 aMix, kCutoff, kRes
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>

f1 0 8192 10 1

; Play pad sound

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the lpform opcode for formant filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 1
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; lpform opcode: ares lpform asig, kfiltq, kfco
    ; lpform implements a formant filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfiltq - Q factor (bandwidth)
    ; kfco - center frequency in Hz
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.3, p3-0.1, 0.3, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Generate sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 110, 0
    
    ; Sweep formant frequency
    kFormant linseg 400, p3*0.5, 2000, p3*0.5, 600
    
    ; Q factor (lower = wider bandwidth)
    kQ = 50
    
    ; Apply formant filter
    aFilt lpform aSaw, kQ, kFormant
    
    out aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Vowel-like sounds
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.1, 0.7, 0.3
    
    ; Buzz as source
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 220, 20, 1
    
    ; Two formants for vowel simulation
    ; First formant (low)
    kF1 = 730  ; "a" vowel approximation
    aFilt1 lpform aBuzz, 40, kF1
    
    ; Second formant (high)
    kF2 = 1090
    aFilt2 lpform aBuzz, 40, kF2
    
    ; Mix formants
    aMix = aFilt1 + aFilt2*0.7
    
    out aMix * 0.5
endin

instr 3
    ; Morphing between vowels
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 165, 0
    
    ; Morph from "ee" to "oo" formants
    kF1 linseg 270, p3, 300   ; First formant
    kF2 linseg 2300, p3, 870  ; Second formant
    
    ; Apply formants
    aF1 lpform aSaw, 30, kF1
    aF2 lpform aSaw, 40, kF2
    
    aMix = aF1 + aF2*0.6
    
    out aMix * 0.5
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Cosine for buzz
f1 0 8192 11 1

; Play formant sweep
i1 0 3
; Play static vowel
i2 3.5 2.5
; Play morphing vowels
i3 6.5 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the lpf opcode for general low-pass filtering
output:

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; lpf opcode: ares lpf asig, kfreq
    ; lpf is a general low-pass filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfreq - cutoff frequency in Hz
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.4, p3-0.2, 0.4, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate bright signal
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 220, 0
    
    ; Cutoff frequency sweep
    kCutoff expseg 200, p3*0.5, 5000, p3*0.5, 300
    
    ; Apply low-pass filter
    aFiltL lpf aSaw, kCutoff
    aFiltR lpf aSaw, kCutoff*1.02
    
    outs aFiltL, aFiltR
endin

instr 2
    ; Smooth noise with lpf
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.2, 0.6, 0.4
    
    ; White noise source
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.4, 0
    
    ; Variable filter cutoff
    kCutoff linseg 500, p3*0.3, 3000, p3*0.7, 800
    
    ; Filter the noise
    aFilt lpf aNoise, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt

instr 3
    ; Multi-stage filtering

    ; Square wave

    kCutoff = 1200
    
    ; Apply filter multiple times for steeper rolloff
    aFilt lpf aSq, kCutoff
    aFilt lpf aFilt, kCutoff
    aFilt lpf aFilt, kCutoff
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the rezzy opcode for resonant low-pass filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

instr 1
    ; rezzy opcode: ares rezzy asig, xfco, xres [, imode, iskip]
    ; rezzy is a resonant low-pass filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; xfco - cutoff frequency in Hz
    ; xres - resonance (typically 0-1, can go higher for self-oscillation)
    ; imode - filter mode (1=lowpass, 2=highpass, 3=bandpass)
    ; iskip - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Generate bright sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp, 220, 0
    
    ; Sweep cutoff frequency
    kCutoff expseg 150, p3*0.5, 4000, p3*0.5, 200
    
    ; Moderate resonance
    kRes = 0.7
    
    ; Apply rezzy low-pass filter (mode 1)
    aFiltL rezzy aSaw, kCutoff, kRes, 1
    aFiltR rezzy aSaw, kCutoff*1.01, kRes, 1
    
    outs aFiltL, aFiltR
endin

instr 2
    ; High resonance for classic analog sound
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Detuned oscillators
    aSaw1 vco2 kAmp*0.25, 110, 0
    aSaw2 vco2 kAmp*0.25, 110.5, 0
    aMix = aSaw1 + aSaw2
    
    ; Envelope-controlled filter
    kFiltEnv expseg 200, 0.1, 3000, p3-0.1, 180
    
    ; High resonance for squelchy character
    kRes = 0.85
    
    aFilt rezzy aMix, kFiltEnv, kRes, 1
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Self-oscillation demonstration
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.25, p3-0.2, 0.25, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Low amplitude noise as excitation
    aNoise noise 0.02, 0
    
    ; Varying cutoff
    kCutoff linseg 300, p3, 2000
    
    ; Very high resonance (near or at self-oscillation)
    kRes = 0.98
    
    aFilt rezzy aNoise, kCutoff, kRes, 1
    
    outs aFilt*kAmp, aFilt*kAmp
endin

instr 4
    ; Bandpass mode demonstration
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.3
    
    ; White noise source
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.4, 0
    
    ; Sweep bandpass frequency
    kCenter expseg 400, p3*0.6, 3000, p3*0.4, 500
    
    ; High Q for narrow band
    kRes = 0.8
    
    ; Apply rezzy in bandpass mode (mode 3)
    aFilt rezzy aNoise, kCenter, kRes, 3
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 5
    ; Dynamic resonance sweep
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.1, 0.3, p3-0.2, 0.3, 0.1, 0
    
    ; Pulse wave
    aPulse vco2 kAmp, 165, 10, 0.3
    
    ; Fixed cutoff
    kCutoff = 1500
    
    ; Sweep resonance
    kRes linseg 0.2, p3*0.5, 0.9, p3*0.5, 0.3
    
    aFilt rezzy aPulse, kCutoff, kRes, 1
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play filter sweep
i1 0 4
; Play high resonance
i2 4.5 3
; Play self-oscillation
i3 8 4
; Play bandpass mode
i4 12.5 3
; Play resonance sweep
i5 16 4

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the statevar opcode for state variable filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; statevar opcode: ahp, alp, abp, abr statevar asig, kcf, kq [, iosamps] [, istor]
    ; statevar is a state variable filter providing simultaneous outputs
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - cutoff frequency (in Hz)
    ; kq - resonance (Q factor, typically 1 to 20)
    ; iosamps - oversampling factor (optional)
    ; istor - skip initialization (optional)
    ; Outputs: ahp (highpass), alp (lowpass), abp (bandpass), abr (band-reject)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 0
    
    ; Static filter
    kCutoff = 800
    kQ = 5
    
    ; Apply state variable filter
    aHP, aLP, aBP, aBR statevar aSaw, kCutoff, kQ
    
    ; Output lowpass and highpass
    outs aLP, aHP
endin

instr 2
    ; Sweep filter with all outputs
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Square wave source
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.25, 165, 2
    
    ; Sweep cutoff frequency
    kCutoff expseg 200, p3, 4000
    kQ = 8
    
    ; Get all filter outputs
    aHP, aLP, aBP, aBR statevar aSq, kCutoff, kQ
    
    ; Use different outputs for left/right
    outs aLP*0.8, aBP*0.8
endin

instr 3
    ; Resonant filter with modulated Q
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Rich sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 110, 0
    
    ; Fixed cutoff, modulated resonance
    kCutoff = 600
    kLFO oscili 8, 0.5, giSine
    kQ = 4 + kLFO
    
    ; Apply filter
    aHP, aLP, aBP, aBR statevar aSaw, kCutoff, kQ
    
    ; Output bandpass for vocal-like effect
    outs aBP, aBP
endin

instr 4
    ; Parallel filter bank using multiple statevars
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.08, 0.5, 0.3
    
    ; White noise source
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.3, 0
    
    ; Three filters at different frequencies
    kQ = 10
    
    aHP1, aLP1, aBP1, aBR1 statevar aNoise, 400, kQ
    aHP2, aLP2, aBP2, aBR2 statevar aNoise, 800, kQ
    aHP3, aLP3, aBP3, aBR3 statevar aNoise, 1600, kQ
    
    ; Sum bandpass outputs for formant-like sound
    aOut = (aBP1 + aBP2 + aBP3) * 0.5
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play static filter
i1 0 3

; Play sweep
i2 3.5 5

; Play modulated Q
i3 9 4

; Play filter bank
i4 13.5 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the svfilter opcode for multimode state variable filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; svfilter opcode: alow, ahigh, aband, anotch svfilter asig, kcf, kq [, iscl] [, iskip]
    ; svfilter is a state variable filter with four simultaneous outputs
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kcf - cutoff/center frequency (in Hz)
    ; kq - resonance/Q factor
    ; iscl - scale factor (optional)
    ; iskip - skip initialization (optional)
    ; Outputs: alow, ahigh, aband, anotch
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Bright sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 330, 0
    
    ; Apply filter
    kCutoff = 1000
    kQ = 6
    
    aLow, aHigh, aBand, aNotch svfilter aSaw, kCutoff, kQ
    
    ; Demonstrate different outputs
    outs aLow, aBand
endin

instr 2
    ; Morphing between filter types
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Square wave
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 2
    
    ; Filter parameters
    kCutoff = 800
    kQ = 8
    
    ; Get all outputs
    aLow, aHigh, aBand, aNotch svfilter aSq, kCutoff, kQ
    
    ; Crossfade between filter types over time
    kMix linseg 0, p3, 3
    
    ; 0-1: lowpass to bandpass
    ; 1-2: bandpass to highpass  
    ; 2-3: highpass to notch
    if kMix < 1 then
        aOut = aLow * (1-kMix) + aBand * kMix
    elseif kMix < 2 then
        aOut = aBand * (2-kMix) + aHigh * (kMix-1)
    else
        aOut = aHigh * (3-kMix) + aNotch * (kMix-2)
    endif
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

instr 3
    ; TB-303 style acid bass
    kAmp madsr 0.003, 0.05, 0.3, 0.2
    
    ; Sawtooth oscillator
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.35, p4, 0
    
    ; Envelope-controlled filter
    kFiltEnv madsr 0.01, 0.3, 0.2, 0.1
    kCutoff = 200 + kFiltEnv * 2500
    kQ = 12
    
    ; Apply resonant lowpass
    aLow, aHigh, aBand, aNotch svfilter aSaw, kCutoff, kQ
    
    ; Add some bandpass for extra character
    aOut = aLow*0.8 + aBand*0.2
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

instr 4
    ; Vocal formant synthesis using parallel filters
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.3, p3-0.1, 0.3, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Buzz source (vocal cords)
    aBuzz buzz kAmp*0.3, 120, 40, giSine
    
    ; First formant (F1)
    kF1 = 730   ; "ah" vowel
    kQ1 = 8
    aL1, aH1, aB1, aN1 svfilter aBuzz, kF1, kQ1
    
    ; Second formant (F2)
    kF2 = 1090
    kQ2 = 10
    aL2, aH2, aB2, aN2 svfilter aBuzz, kF2, kQ2
    
    ; Third formant (F3)
    kF3 = 2440
    kQ3 = 12
    aL3, aH3, aB3, aN3 svfilter aBuzz, kF3, kQ3
    
    ; Mix formants with appropriate levels
    aOut = aB1*0.5 + aB2*0.3 + aB3*0.15
    
    outs aOut, aOut
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play basic filter
i1 0 3

; Play morphing
i2 3.5 6

; Play acid bass line
i3 10 0.5 55
i3 10.5 0.5 55
i3 11 0.8 82.4
i3 12 0.5 110
i3 13 1 55

; Play vowel
i4 15 3

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the bqrez opcode for biquad resonant filtering
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; bqrez opcode: ares bqrez asig, xfco, xres [, imode] [, iskip]
    ; bqrez is a biquad multi-mode filter
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; xfco - cutoff/center frequency (Hz)
    ; xres - resonance (bandwidth in Hz for bandpass, Q for lowpass/highpass)
    ; imode - filter mode: 0=lowpass, 1=highpass, 2=bandpass (default=0)
    ; iskip - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 0
    
    ; Lowpass mode with resonance
    kCutoff = 1200
    kRes = 20  ; High Q for resonance
    iMode = 0  ; Lowpass
    
    ; Apply filter
    aFilt bqrez aSaw, kCutoff, kRes, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Sweep filter in highpass mode
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; White noise
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.35, 0
    
    ; Sweep highpass cutoff
    kCutoff expseg 100, p3, 5000
    kRes = 8
    iMode = 1  ; Highpass
    
    aFilt bqrez aNoise, kCutoff, kRes, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Resonant bandpass for formant-like sound
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 165, 0
    
    ; Bandpass mode with narrow bandwidth
    kCenter = 800
    kBW = 50    ; Bandwidth in Hz for bandpass mode
    iMode = 2   ; Bandpass
    
    aFilt bqrez aSaw, kCenter, kBW, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 4
    ; Self-oscillating filter
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.08, 0.4, 0.3
    
    ; Low amplitude source
    aExcite noise kAmp*0.05, 0
    
    ; Very high resonance causes self-oscillation
    kCutoff = p4
    kRes = 50   ; Extreme resonance
    iMode = 0
    
    aFilt bqrez aExcite, kCutoff, kRes, iMode
    
    outs aFilt*0.3, aFilt*0.3
endin

instr 5
    ; Multi-mode filter with LFO modulation
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.12, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; Square wave
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.25, 110, 2
    
    ; LFO modulates cutoff
    kLFO oscili 1000, 0.4, giSine
    kCutoff = 400 + kLFO
    kRes = 15
    
    ; Switch between modes based on time
    iMode = p4
    
    aFilt bqrez aSq, kCutoff, kRes, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play lowpass
i1 0 3

; Play highpass sweep
i2 3.5 4

; Play bandpass
i3 8 3

; Play self-oscillation at different pitches
i4 11.5 1 440
i4 12.5 1 550
i4 13.5 1 660

; Play modulated filters in different modes
i5 16 4 0  ; Lowpass
i5 16 4 1  ; Highpass
i5 16 4 2  ; Bandpass

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>

instruction: Write a CSound instrument that demonstrates the rbjeq opcode for Robert Bristow-Johnson's EQ filters
output:
<CsoundSynthesizer>
<CsOptions>
-odac
</CsOptions>
<CsInstruments>

sr = 44100
kr = 4410
ksmps = 10
nchnls = 2
0dbfs = 1

; Function table: sine wave
giSine ftgen 1, 0, 8192, 10, 1

instr 1
    ; rbjeq opcode: ares rbjeq asig, kfco, klvl, kQ, kS, imode [, iskip]
    ; rbjeq implements various filter types using RBJ's Audio EQ Cookbook
    ; asig - input audio signal
    ; kfco - cutoff/center frequency (Hz)
    ; klvl - level/gain (dB for peaking/shelving, not used for others)
    ; kQ - Q factor (bandwidth)
    ; kS - shelf slope (for shelving filters, 0.5 to 2)
    ; imode - filter type: 0=lowpass, 1=highpass, 2=bandpass(BPF),
    ;         3=band-reject, 4=peaking, 5=low-shelf, 6=high-shelf, 7=bandpass(CSG)
    ; iskip - skip initialization (optional)
    
    ; Amplitude envelope
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.3, 220, 0
    
    ; Lowpass filter
    kCutoff = 1000
    kLevel = 0     ; Not used for lowpass
    kQ = 0.707     ; Butterworth response
    kS = 1         ; Not used for lowpass
    iMode = 0      ; Lowpass
    
    aFilt rbjeq aSaw, kCutoff, kLevel, kQ, kS, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 2
    ; Peaking EQ for tone shaping
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Full spectrum source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 165, 0
    
    ; Boost at 800 Hz
    kCenter = 800
    kBoost = 12    ; 12 dB boost
    kQ = 2
    kS = 1
    iMode = 4      ; Peaking EQ
    
    aFilt rbjeq aSaw, kCenter, kBoost, kQ, kS, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 3
    ; Low-shelf EQ for bass adjustment
    kAmp linseg 0, 0.05, 0.35, p3-0.1, 0.35, 0.05, 0
    
    ; Bass-heavy sawtooth
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 110, 0
    
    ; Boost low frequencies
    kShelfFreq = 200
    kBoost = 6     ; 6 dB boost
    kQ = 1
    kSlope = 1     ; Shelf slope
    iMode = 5      ; Low-shelf
    
    aFilt rbjeq aSaw, kShelfFreq, kBoost, kQ, kSlope, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 4
    ; High-shelf EQ for brightness
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.12, 0.55, 0.35
    
    ; Square wave
    aSq vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 2
    
    ; Boost high frequencies
    kShelfFreq = 2000
    kBoost = 8     ; 8 dB boost
    kQ = 0.707
    kSlope = 1.5
    iMode = 6      ; High-shelf
    
    aFilt rbjeq aSq, kShelfFreq, kBoost, kQ, kSlope, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 5
    ; Notch filter to remove frequency
    kAmp madsr 0.005, 0.08, 0.5, 0.3
    
    ; White noise
    aNoise noise kAmp*0.35, 0
    
    ; Notch out 1000 Hz
    kNotch = 1000
    kLevel = 0
    kQ = 10        ; Narrow notch
    kS = 1
    iMode = 3      ; Band-reject (notch)
    
    aFilt rbjeq aNoise, kNotch, kLevel, kQ, kS, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

instr 6
    ; Multi-band EQ chain
    kAmp madsr 0.01, 0.1, 0.6, 0.3
    
    ; Rich source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 220, 0
    
    ; Low-shelf: boost bass
    aEQ1 rbjeq aSaw, 100, 4, 1, 1, 5
    
    ; Peaking: cut muddy mids
    aEQ2 rbjeq aEQ1, 400, -6, 2, 1, 4
    
    ; Peaking: boost presence
    aEQ3 rbjeq aEQ2, 2000, 5, 2, 1, 4
    
    ; High-shelf: add air
    aEQ4 rbjeq aEQ3, 8000, 3, 0.707, 1, 6
    
    outs aEQ4, aEQ4
endin

instr 7
    ; Dynamic EQ with modulated parameters
    kAmp madsr 0.02, 0.15, 0.5, 0.4
    
    ; Sawtooth source
    aSaw vco2 kAmp*0.25, 165, 0
    
    ; LFO modulates boost amount
    kLFO oscili 8, 0.5, giSine
    kBoost = 6 + kLFO
    
    ; Sweep center frequency
    kCenter linseg 300, p3, 2000
    
    kQ = 3
    kS = 1
    iMode = 4  ; Peaking
    
    aFilt rbjeq aSaw, kCenter, kBoost, kQ, kS, iMode
    
    outs aFilt, aFilt
endin

</CsInstruments>
<CsScore>

; Play lowpass
i1 0 3

; Play peaking boost
i2 3.5 3

; Play low-shelf
i3 7 3

; Play high-shelf
i4 10.5 3

; Play notch
i5 14 3

; Play multi-band EQ
i6 17.5 4

; Play dynamic EQ
i7 22 5

e
</CsScore>
</CsoundSynthesizer>
